It was a cool but sunny day, so the gardens were lovely, but they do require a lot of walking and there are stairs and steep paths to negotiate. This was one of the few places we visited where Russian seemed to be the only form of communication and I'm glad we had a guide with us who told us about entry and exit rules, where to find toilets, etc. It would have been very confusing on your own. The Palace doesn't seem to have been restored with the same attention to detail and care as other attractions. The gardens are lovely, but bordering on kitsch. There are a number of "amusements" installed where if you walk to a bench or over a stone path sprinklers or other water features turn on (apparently a real "hoot" back in the day!). But you aren't warned about them so if you are walking about on your own there's a potential to end up with an unexpected soaking.

An absolute must it is brilliant - genuine review. This Grand Palace, gardens and fountains is an absolute must see when visiting this amazing city it is just glorious. We were on a tour with an amazing guide who I could recommend if you need one so she managed to get us a tour of the pipes under the fountains which was very interesting. Get there early this is a major sight so attracts lots of tourists - you will love it.

Lots of queuing but worth it . Try and go early or at lunch time, so as to avoid the large tour groups. This way you can linger in each room. Enjoy the grounds and if the weather is fine, plan by bringing some food and use this as your base.
Be there at 11 o'clock sharp. Because the minute when the fountains start with the music and all is just magical.The interior of the palace is also wonderful

Dazzling Fountains. It takes the better part of a day to wander through the vast gardens of the palace, and take in the beauty of the Palace. The fountains spread through he gardens are online anything I've seen before.

Palace with a fantastic Garden. This historic palace has a fantastic garden and statues that is comparable to Versaille of France. Our visit here was a treat for camera buff. This is a must see while visiting St. Petersburg.
Worth the trip. Even if you have seen Versailles, Schönbrunn or Sans-Soucis: It's worth a day trip. You might want to avoid getting really hungry there...

Great outdoor for everyone. Peterhof is such a great place to visit. In a summertime, it is not too hot due to the location by the sea (Finland Gulf). We spent most of the time in the garden area (upper and lower). Next visit will try the indoor exhibition. We love the fountains!! The kids would love going there for the trick fountains (the water splash in the restricted areas across the lower gardens). In May, you can still see some colorful tulips in the gardens. Hi-light is the main fountain that runs through the gulf. It is absolutely breathtaking! To get there, taking metro red line (M1) and getting off at Batiskaya station. Then make your way through the way out to hop on the minibus no 404 (you can see it right away, can't miss it) with the name Peterhof on it (costs 70 RUB/person). Pay in cash only to the driver himself. The bus took roughly 30-45 minutes. It passes the presidential residence of Russia (locating near the palace) as well. Get off at the main gate, the bus driver will shout the name out loud. It takes around 2-3 hours walking in the huge park. There are ice-cream and drink vendors everywhere. However, the toilets are quite limited. If you are going to have lunch there, I recommend having in the proper restaurant so that you can use their toilet for free (and cleaner). Toilet in the upper garden is paid-toilet (30 RUB). Another one in the lower garden is free (but extremely crowded and not so clean). To get back to St. Petersburg, cruising along the gulf with hydrofoil, a russian style ferry, is a must. You can purchase the ticket around the bay area, it costs 550 RUB for one way. The piers are just 10 minutes walk. The boat itself is quite old but still very good quality. The website says the cruising trip takes 30 minutes (they even claimed that it is faster than bus because of no traffic). However, for our trip, it was 45 minutes long!! (Don't know why!)Anyway, I still enjoy the trip. Strongly recommended!

Incredible palace. This is centre piece of very large compound. 100% worth seeing. Fantastic halls, so well restored. When you see how it looked in 1944 you cannot believe how it is restored - miracle!Don't forget that if you are individual foreign tourist you pay little more for visit but you can jump the queue! Very helpful particularly in tourist season!
Incredible!. What a way of living the zares had! Amazing palace, gardens and fountains. You have to go in summer yo appreciate such a beauty. Go by hidrofoil! It is easier and faster than buses

Grandeur and splendour. . Another amazing museum of Tsarist Russia. The gardens on this occasion are possibly better then the building. Exquisite fountains, walkways and water features. Very impressive.

Fantastic fountains. In my tour book, this place is called Peterhof Palace. Located nearly an hour outside of St. Petersburg, you can uber here for about 1000 rubles, or you can take a fast-speed ferry here.From what I can tell, most people come here to see the fountain. And what a fountain it is. It's simply gorgeous, and worth the visit just for it. In fact, judging from the entrance fees, the palace itself is almost thrown in for free. I guess everyone is here for the outdoor fountain.We didn't visit the Palace, just walked in the garden until water-front. If the weather is good, be sure to come here and see the fountain.

Stunning palace and location. Wow stunning location n grounds are beautiful perfectly manicured with fountains at every turn. Views from the palace direct to the sea are magnificent. The palace itself is so palatial and luxurious. Not allowed to take photos and have to wear shoe protectors, As the beautiful floors need protecting but a bit slippery for us not so young. Allow at least 4 hours especially if you want to wander around the lovely grounds.

A must see palace. We loved our visit there, despite being rushed about by our private guide. We could have skipped the guide. There are descriptions in English in the rooms and you can manage without any russian knowledge at the palace and hydrofoil ticket booths. Plan to have lunch at one of the restaurants located in the gardens. I would have loved to spend a whole day there. If travelling with older people, plan to get there by taxi and take the hydrofoil back to St Petersburg (if choosing the other way, you'll have to climb all the park stairs to get to the Palace). Wheelchairs available at the palace ( no charge, you just leave an ID as a guarantee). You'll have to wear shoes covers to visit the palace. Beware as it can then be slippery on brand new wooden floor. When we visited, there were other people but it wasn't that crowded despite the sunny day. Enjoy your visit!

Great example of opulence of the aristocrats. This place is overwhelmingly reminding me of the opulence of the Aristocrats. Also, the interiors, which we were not allowed to take photos of are not as impressive as those in Catherine Palace. I wish I didn't bother to get inside only to be treated badly by the old ladies there who seem to own the place, they were rude to just about everyone as if we would be stealing the nasty stuff there. I would advise you to stick to the Fountains and avoid visiting inside as there's not much to see as you would be told to go go go..move forward as if we were herded animals. Those ladies should retire or get trained in proper customer service! Not happy inside or outside this place!

Good value for money. Palaces are beautiful and luxury. There is a funny place in Grand Palace which is called sprinkling stone. Outside the palace there is a small forest. Sight seeing there is also beautiful and can make you relax.

Beautiful palace. We took the hydro-foil over which was fun and saved a lot of time. The outside of the palace and grounds are beautiful. I would strongly advise checking the hours when it's open. We went on the last Tuesday of the month which just happened to be cleaning day so the palace was closed.

Day out down river. Definitely worth a visit while in St Petersburg. A short hop down river on a hydrofoil. The gardens are a peaceful place to wander around when not too busy and the palace itself is a marvel of reconstruction (most of it destroyed in WWII)
breathtaking. this palace and fountains are just beyond words gorgeous! you can only imagine the clothes and people of the past coming to visit this beautiful place

You must visit Peterhof. Went on a small private tour. Drove there and toured the palace, wandered the upper and lower gardens and then took the hydrofoil back to SPB. You can do it on your own, but why would you want to? The hydrofoil ride back to the city was smooth and a nice way to end the day.

Cruise Ship Excursion. As a part of our Royal Caribbean cruise ship tour of the Baltic region, we chose an excursion to Peterhof Palace in St. Petersburg on May 26. The excursion also included the Hermitage Palace. Peterhof wows you from the moment you set eyes on it. The real gold domes and adornments sparkle like precious gems come rain or come shine. The spectacular fountains surrounded by gilded statuary gain even more attention at 11am when the fountains release their plumes of water to a beautiful symphony of music. The canal leading from the fountains feeds right into the Baltic Sea, making this a well planned defensive location by it's designer, Peter the Great. Stash your cameras once you get inside the palace. No photography is allowed. Hoards of tourists flock to Peterhof by the bus load. The tour pace is quite fast inside with no time to loiter or stare very long at each room. A Russian woman is seated in each room watching each person to ensure you don't become too familiar with anything you see. Their appearance is fairly stern with no smile in return. All palace rooms are chocked with much to take in, but little time to give more than a passing glance...It's still amazing to visit. I enjoyed the gardens which featured mostly beautiful tulips at this time of year. Lilacs were also a nice fragrant feature that we saw in each of the Baltic regions. Take note of the lovely white marble statues that flank the chessboard fountain at Peterhof. Each statue was buried under ground during WWII to preserve them. I hope you enjoy your visit as much as we did. Would like to have had more time.

Incredible!. This is by far the most stunning of the Palaces we saw in our 2 day tour of St. Petersburg. You walk through the gardens and then you see the stunning view of the palace, the water fountains and the gold statues. It is quite remarkable. Be sure your quite explains how the fountains work without pumps (they are the same as they were 200 years ago). It is also impressive to see how much damage was done during the war and how they restored it.

Fabulous fountains; lovely grounds. We travelled to and from Petergof by hydrofoil, which felt like a trip into the future we expected in the 1970s - a future of hydrofoils, hovercraft, and Concorde supersonic planes. Highly recommended, before they all get retired as uneconomic.If you take the 10am hydrofoil and then walk briskly along the canal you can bag a place on the bridge and watch the fountains get turned on (to music) at 11am.Petergof itself is spectacular. I was last here in the 1990s and it has been substantially fixed up. All the fountains fully working and well maintained; the grounds well kept; toilets clean; snack and ice cream kiosks sprinkled about.As others have noted, each attraction is 'a la carte' - we did a couple but couldn't stomach the queue for the palace. The Hermitage with its art display and mechanical lifting table wasn't worth the 500 roubles entrance.We just enjoyed strolling around the grounds, visiting each fountain, and people watching. Be sure to visit the 'joke' fountains, especially the one on the main path that is only activated 3 times a day (1pm, 3pm, ???). Just follow the shrieks and laughs of children and enjoy the fun. If you have kids, consider whether you want to let them play in the joke fountains and get wet, and bring appropriate clothes.We ate at one of the kiosks and it was serviceable. The ice cream was fine though!Note that the kiosks sell nuts to feed the squirrels, which we passed on. Good thing too, as we only saw one squirrel all day and he was clearly so overfed he wasn't interested in what the other tourists were offering!

The gardens are amazing. Our tour, TJTravel, took us through the gardens because the weather was so good that day. We saw all the gimmick fountains with great background information from Dina. The trip to Peterhof on the hydrofoil is fun too. It is an amazing place.

Be sure to get there by 11!. The gardens and fountains are great. We arrived around 10 am via hydrofoil from St. Petersburg. It's much more convenient than by car which can take from 60-90 minutes depending on traffic.At 11 am they turn on the fountains and you really want to be there to see it.Walking through the palace takes about an hour. There's a course laid out and you need to follow the crowd. It's difficult to linger or go back. Some of the stuff that was saved in the palace is truly magnificent.The gardens were my favorite, particularly the surprise fountains. Be sure you have a guide! :-) We had a relatively nice day so it was very pleasant to just wander around and see the variety of fountains.
Peterborough Palace. Transportation was not as nice as it was advertised. The car was a bit dearty with a bad odor.I wish our guide was more detailed on the tour
The fountains are amazing. I got to go inside the palace and go into the gardens. The fountains and gardens are amazing. This was one of my most favorite palaces I have ever visited.

Stunning Gardens in a wonderful Location. Peterhof palace gardens and fountains are a wonderful way to spend a half day with the 125 hectare park right on the Baltic looking back towards St Petersburg and out to the Gulf of Finland. While there were a lot of people the gardens were spread out and easy to find some peace and quiet. Stunning fountains all fed by water pressure at height and through pipes of different diameters.
Worth the RUB600 entrance fee . The attraction is not stroller friendly, but the visit takes around 40 minutes so it is manageable with small children. Very beautiful inside and well restored.

Best of SP. Personally I found this the best place to come to in SP. The palace, the gardens, the overall experience was fantastic. there is a kind of romance and peace that exudes from this place. Spend a whole day here. There are cafes and food carts all over. You have to take a short ferry ride to this island.

Stunning inside and out. Great history and amazing depiction of what life in the time of the Tsar's was like. In addition to the opulence of the interior, do not miss the amazing gardens. We also got to go down into the grotto and see the secret entertaining area (with trick fountains) and the waterworks that support the main fountain leading up to the palace. Impressive. We do not think very many tours take you into the grotto so ask. Our guide also had reservations for us in the original green house for the palace now turned into a restaurant. This provided a good meal and wonderful ambience.

Just the garden. Visited just the gardens to see the fountains. They are beautiful. Didnt bother with the palaces. R700 just for the grounds is a bit costly compared to other attractions in St P & Moscow.

So much beauty. We caught the hydrofoil to Peterhof . Walked in just before the fountains start at 11am . It was a Thursday and the crowds were'nt too bad . Decided to stay in the lower gardens and not go in the palace . The gardens are so beautiful , every time we thought we were almost finished we would come across another fountain , view , statue . My only criticism would be there is not one ticket that gets you into garden and palace as well as the smaller attractions in the garden . Caught the hydrofoil back to St Petersburg. Amazing day out .
Historical and tender!!. I was travelled to this magnificent palace in July 2014 with my Indonesian friends!)) We really like it!! Terima kasih!) Inside of this palace history
Fairy tale. Amazing gardens with beautiful fountains and goldplated sparkling ornaments. Park beautifully trimmed. Can easily be reached by minibus and hydrofoil from St. Petersburg.

It's a pleasant relaxing time . Upper Garden is mostly museums. Lower garden is mostly fountains. So if you want to see either the Upper Garden and museums or both that and the Lower Garden, take the metro and mini bus from St Petersburg. It's cheap and easy and you begin in the upper where you don't pay until you enter museums. I did this but did not go to any of the museums. Once you are ready, you pay to enter the Lower Garden. Take your time it's not that big a hurry. Make sure to go all the way to the waterfront. It's much quieter there with even some sand beach for children to play on or take a nap. After touring the Lower Garden, take the hydrofoil back to SP. the metro and mini bus is 105 u per person total. The hydrofoil is 700ru per person one way.

Go as early as possible. Long wait to get in check ur tour company. Over the top wealth and opulence but took us about 90 minutes to get in. We went with shore excursions and had to wait. Friends used "red October" tour company and did not have to wait. Might be worth the extra money to check that out and use them. So so very crowded everywhere we went. Enjoyed the gardens most as you didn't have rude tourists trying to knock you over

Beautiful and Amazing!!!. We came to the Grand Palace as part of a tour (SPB Tours) Please feel free to read my comments about them and the tour in another review. The Grand Palace is something that I was not expecting while on I read the tour itinerary. This place was postcard picturesque. My only complaint is that you can't get a "clean" photo because there are so many tourists visiting this place. If you are traveling here on your own, this is a stop that is a must. The outside landscape is amazing and enjoyable as you walkthrough. I would recommend all my friends and family to see this amazing place.Here is my rating scale.1 - Never Again, Avoid at all costs2 - Poor experience. Look for alternatives3 - Decent. Has pros and cons. 4 - Good. Would Recommend.5 - Incredible - Makes me want to come back and do it again.
Nice 😊. Everything was just great. It is a shame that you cannot take photographs inside. The weather was nice so walk in the park was very pleasant.

Summer Palace. Definitely have a guide, there is so much to know about the palace and its history. We were lucky the fountains had been turned on, they are amazing, the grounds are large, comfortable shoes will make your day more enjoyable.

Beautiful gardens. It is nice to get outside the city and explore. The summer palace has most amazing gardens and fountains. Look for Peter the greats trick fountains! Touring the palace was interesting but extremely crowded.

Repetitive and crowded . We went on a Sunday afternoon. It was crowded. It is very expensive to visit. Considering the cost of the ferry boat ( about $35 round trip per person), $10 entrance fee to the garden, another $5 entrance fee to the palace). Also tickets to the garden and palace are sold in too different places, so you have to wait in line two times ( a waist of time for tourists). Then you have to wait in line again to get in. They allow a few people at a time to keep a proper flow through the palace.You only see a few rooms in the palace. The whole place was rebuild in the 1960s since it was burned and abandoned before. All the interior contents (paintings, pictures, decorations, furniture,etc) are representatives of the era and not original. Nice job though on the the rebuild.The fountains were very beautiful and the garden was nice. The food sold there is terrible. Plan to bring you own snacks with you or expect to pan an arm and a leg for disgusting fast food (hamburger with God knows what inside it, and hotdogs).

Russian Versailles. Visited Russia's "Versailles" on an Express to Russia private tour. Highly recommend some sort of private tour as this summer palace of the tsars has interesting history. No pictures inside of the palace - but do not fear the outside is as exquisite if not more than the palace's inside. Peter the Great was inspired by Louis XIV's Versailles and built equally magnificent fountains that run via gravity only (no pumps in these gardens). The fountains turn on at 11am. Peter apparently was quite the trickster - watch out for his trick fountains around the gardens that he used to soak innocent guests.

Peterhof!. take the hydrofoil to reach Peterhof. keep lots of time to explore the lower gardens with all their trick fountains! and the palace itself is grand! there are too many things to see here! and different tickets to enter different parts of Peterhof. so plan ahead and get vouchers for the places you want to see.
A must.. A must to see. Beautiful place with amazing fountains. Worth a day trip if you have time. Will give you a a unique experience of Peter the Great epoch.

Beautiful walk. We went in march so unfortunately the garden was not in bloom. But the building is incredible from the outside, and there's a beautiful walk around the garden with the palace in the background. There was a huge line to enter the palace so we didn't go in, but it was still totally worth it! There are souvenir stands outside the palace, they are significantly cheaper than in the city - at least in my experience.

Unbelievable place. It's hard to believe that someone could build a place like this. There's so much gold, huge gardens, ponds, buildings, sculptures and so on. It's a must see when visiting St. Petersburg.We arrived by water taxi/hydrofoil. It's a fast and easy way to get there. Beware that you have to pay to enter the area (and there's NOTHING between the pier and the gate to the palace area), so make sure you bring money to get in. If you have the Petersburg Card you get free entrance to the palace, one way free hydrofoil ride and return ride 200 RUP off.

Peterhof. This palace is amazing. Inside it is all in gold. You are unable to take photos. There are 20 rooms that you can go into. Outside in the gardens, it's probably the most beautiful gardens I have ever seen.
So much gold. The grounds of the Grand Palace are crowded, beautiful, glowing with gold statuary, and many fine fountains, and can't be missed.
Magic place. Very nice and magic place, beatiful gardens and fontain was absolutly fantastic. To see that I recomandet to visit this place in sunny day.

Fountain is the best part. . If you plan to leave St Petersburg, I would chose this in Peterhof instead of Pushkin. The palace is nice but many look the same. There are lots of baroque style rooms. The unique room is made of amber on the wall quite beautiful. Took a lot of work to refurbish after the war. Many restoration specialists went through photos to get the right color of stone to make it as close to original as possible. The fountain though is unique. It is run entirely without pumps. A must see! You can get here easily by one of the hydrofoils from St Petersburg. Faster than driving.

Amazing !!!. Beautifull place, for feeling relaxed and stop rush for a moment. You can feel a greatness of russian history. Visited during ice hockey world championship and was really pleasently surprised by all the places in Petersburg not even this one.

Beautiful . We had an amazing experience visiting the summer palace. Beautiful location and great history. It's sad all has been reconstructed and almost nothing is authentic. Awesome gardens and good sightseeing.

Nice monument with gardens and fountains. Go there on a sunny day and enjoy walking outside in the gardens and between the fountains. You can go there by express boat shuttle from Hermitage and have a nice boat ride with beautiful views of Petersburg too.

Simply stunning!. It is a shame you can't take photos inside the palace as it is fantastic but there are booklets you can purchase for a small sum of money before you leave which has everything in it. The gardens are stunning as is all the wonderful fountains. There is a small restaurant where you can rest awhile and recharge your batteries to continue your travels. The palace is about 45 mins drive from the city so arrange a tour of sorts.

All in gold!. We took the "Meteor" boat from the Admiralty embarqument and that cost us 1300RUB/pax round trip. And you arrive within 30 min directly to the park from the side of the Gulf of Finland wich is fabulous experience. Once got off the boat you'll have to pay the entrance ticket. Many tourists and if you want to enter to the palace itself you need to pay an extra ticket baught there. Travelling this way you skip the train and bus and you must not spen 1.5 hours to go there and the same to go back.

Best seen on a sunny day. The opulence of this palace takes your breath away but it's the gardens that really amaze. On a sunny day, the fountains glint in the sunlight and hint at days past of Russian extravagance in the extreme. Really beautiful.

Versailles in St Petersburg. We only did the gardens, absolutely stunning fountains and grounds, in May they were very beautiful. The engineering with no pumps fascinated my partner!! From here we took the hydrofoil back to the ship across the Gulf of Finland and that gives a lovely perspective and views. This is a bit out of the city but should be on your list!!

One of most beautiful Russian parks. It's strongly suggested a visit during spring-summer period, when all fountains are opened. Beautiful for romantic trip in couple or with children of all ages.Toilet availability is not so nice (only two on lower park, with long row).

PETERHOF. I think this is the most beautiful palace in the world !!! i dont know what to say how to describe it ,its simply amazing .The fountains of Peterhof are one of Russia's most famous tourist attractions drawing millions of visitors every year. Only 1 weak point NO ENGLISH Radio which is weird in such a historical palace like that .

The VERSAILLES of the Romanovs. I do not know how it is in Winter, but in May, it is Paradise. A must see on our 4 days trip in St Petersbourg. Gold, flowers, fountains, green parks, everything to enjoy the delicious spring weather along the bay. I wish I could sail to VERSAILLES, but here you can! Thanks Peter for this heaven on earth.

Magical. Beautiful gardens and fountains. Do visit the interior if you have time one hour tops! Eating is limited, bring some food or get easy to eat at a local stand. The restaurant are pretty crowded.
Vacation. Peter the great emperor has done a magnificent palace on the banks of Baltic Sea / gulf of Finland. Cascade, Fountains are to be seen. worth going.

Spectacular!. We had the most glorious weather So we're able to enjoy the park and the palace. Petergof Palace was so beautiful. The restoration work beautifully done and it was great to see the contrast between the original Peter the Great rooms and the later Elizabeth rooms with their extensive gilding. The grounds are massive, so comfy shoes are a must, and there are trick fountains for kids and adults alike to get wet in. Well worth the hour or so drive from the centre of St Petersburg.

Beautiful grounds and interior - parts suitable for those with limited mobility. This palace certainly has the wow factor. The grounds extend some 120 Ha and are accessible by electric train 'tours' for this that can't walk. The palace itself was stunning and each room had its own purpose and homage to its creators and previous owners. One not to miss, if you take your walking shoes be prepared for 6km of walking if you want to take in the palace and ground!

Excellent!!. Grand palace is a good place to visit. Though the palace in itself was nothing after visiting the other palaces - Catherine palace, winter palace - but the gardens were beautiful... Particularly the lower garden... The fountains were beautiful... The entire walk till the point of river Neva is beautiful... Recommended to visit.... Though can just visit the gardens and can give a skip to the palace!!
Must see place in St. PETERSBURG . Amazing view, park, statues, and palaces! You should go on Summer, after May, so everything will be green!

Strange policy for visiting Peterhof. Caught a Mastruska van to Peterhof from Avtovo metro - that was easy. Walking through the Lower Gardens was lovely even though it was raining. Came to the ticket office and that seemed to be when the problems started.Trying to get a ticket was a joke - first the ticket office told us that we had to go through the entrance barriers - which we couldn't do as we had no ticket and the staff on the ticket barriers told us to go back to the ticket office to get a ticket to gain access to the gardens of the Grand Palace.... and then you can get another ticket to gain entrance to the Grand Palace. So off we went to get our garden ticket and then went through to view the gardens. Spent some time taking photos of the gold statues and the exterior. The garden was stunning. We then went to buy our tickets for the Grand Palace. Something I was looking forward too. First we went into a queue only to be told by a guard that the tour was for Russian people only and we could go in at 2pm. We then tried to find another ticket office as we werent sure if we understood te guard and came upon a door with a guard only to be turned away again saying Russians only. As we didn't understand Russian that was all we could decipher. Luckily a couple came out and we asked them did they have problems getting in to which they replied no. One of them went over to find out what the problem was. It seems up until midday anyone can go into the Grand Palace, but from 12-2pm its for Russian only and then from 2pm onward anyone can go in. This isn't mentioned on their website and seems rather odd. As that meant we would have to wait nearly 2 hours. In the end we didn't bother waiting as by then we had been in the rain for sometime and had we known before we would either have left earlier or visited later. The gardens were lovely but it was a waste of our time going given that we wanted to see the interior.Also take note if you have gained access to the garden but want to go to the toilet or coffee you have to leave the complex and you will not be allowed back in - as your ticket is only valid for one entry.
most amazing place. never seen a palace so beautifully located, all the artifacts so well kept and the layout of the palace with gardens is just great.

Overrated. If you've been to the Schonbruen Palace in Vienna you are not missing anything, really. It's huge and lots of gold paint on everything. The walls in the rooms have not been restored to their original opulence. The Russians have done a great job but with comparatively little money and years of neglect, this is a place that's grand for Russia but has nothing on palaces in Austria, Germany and certainly Versailles

Absolutely wonderful place, go here by summer!. A wonderful palace, one of the prettiest in the world. It's absolutely stunning.At summer time the gardens are even prettier and they turn on the fountains. People bring food and drinks and have a great time in the gardens, I can really recommend combining a visit here with a cozy stay at the gardens with some good food and friends or family. Traveling here: maybe 30 minutes (+-15 minutes) by taxi. A taxi drive from this place can cost quite a bit because they take advantage of the situation that it's not easy to travel from here. Make sure the same driver you first hired picks you up or waits for you there. The palace takes a fee for entering, I'm not sure about the park.
Crowded, but worth the visit.. A little way out of the city, but definately worth the trip. The history of this place is extremely interesting, and the turning on of the fountains drew a huge crowd.

Hire a bike to enjoy the entire place. You can actually take a FREE public bus from St Petersburg to Peterhof - ask your hotel concierge - the buses are safe & the passengers & driver are all very friendly. And if you say Peterhof they will know how to direct you ))On the drive into Peterhof on the main road you see a distinct contrast to the sometimes shabby streets of downtown St Petersburg. Here, you will see unique sights like detached, luxury houses, luxury hotels / spas & lots of green & very well manicured gardens, lawns & parks.The Grand Palace & surrounding park is of exceptional beauty & architectural quality - much like St Petersburg but on an even higher level!Passing Samson fountain provides lots of photo opportunities & as you head down to the seafront there are plenty of very good restaurants catering for all tastes including vegetarian.One thing we missed out on is really exploring all the extensive grounds which are readily accessible on any of the numerous hire bikes - highly recommended if you want to (1) see the extensive grounds to the east; (2) enjoy a lot of peace & quiet from the hordes of tourists (many native Russians visit); (3) feel like you have the whole place to yourself - prepare your own picnic! ))The place is very safe & you have the freedom to do as you please - budget for a whole day & plan to arrive around 10am to gain the most from any visit & make it a very good value for money day out.Plenty of photo opportunities so make sure everything is fully charged & plenty of small parks for the children to enjoy too!Tickets are always available on the day, so always check the local forecast & pick the sunniest & warmest day for your trip - can get a little chilly by the sea so always carry a mac!Enjoy! ))
Breathtaking. We visited the palace as part of a cruise excursion.No pictures will make you understand how opulent the palace is. A must visit place if going to st petersburg
Worth the journey. We came in April, before they turn the fountains on, but the palace itself and the items on display more than justify the journey.

fountains galore!. We were lucky enough to visit Peterhof on a glorious sunny day in summer and thus saw the gardens and the magnificent fountains at their best.We did view the interior of the palace but it is really the grounds here, leading down to the edge of the Baltic, which catch the eye. Definitely worth visiting if you are in the vicinity and most folk, like us, seem to combine this with a visit to the Catherine Palace (see separate review).We visited as part of a small group tour, so I can't comment on the value/entry procedures. There were toilet facilities inside the palace and just outside the complex, amid a number of souvenir and fast food stands, should you be in need of refreshment/wish to buy keepsakes.

dress up! . the grand palace gave me a feel I was living in a different era; you take a boat to get there and it is. dry easy to organise there is the palace and a huge park surrounding where you just stroll aroundthere was a possibility to dress up; and you get into the time of that castle even more:-)
another stunning place. lots of tourists but has been very well preserved - and the fountain display is spectacular - great to wander after the palace around the grounds and wonder at a bygone era.

One of most beautiful places on earth . It's not only one of the most beautiful - man made - places in Russia, but in the world. Worthy of a king. Wait it was built by a czar and for a czar (Russian king). It's an absolute must see.

Even Good in Winter. We visited during winter when the fountains don't run but it was still a must-see. The gardens were beautiful and the palace is very grand. We did a self-guided tour of inside the palace and were very glad we did as it is amazing seeing the rooms as they once were. During winter the hydrofoil to the palace doesn't run and the train and bus were a bit complicated (as our Russian is very poor) so we got a cab there and back for approx 2500 roubles (a ripoff but typical 'tourist' price). If you get a taxi there you should arrange for it to pick you up at the end as we did have quite a bit of difficulty trying to find a taxi to take us back to Saint Petersburg and the taxi we did get back was quite questionable!

A place full os story. The best thing me and my boyfriend did was getting a personal guide! We could enjoy this place much more with someone telling us all the story behind each object. The palace is very beautiful and the amber room just breathtaking. I love the russian story and this place definitely has plenty to tell hehe

Opulent palace. We went in early April, therefore we couldn't get there on the hydrofoil. Another option was to use the metro and a public bus, but as most people don't speak any English and it is quite a long way outside the city, we opted for a taxi. We asked our hotel to call us s city taxi not the hotel one, which is much more expensive. The taxi driver didn't speak English,but that wasn't a problem. Great Wi Fi in the taxi. It cost about £12 one way. The palace is stunning, every room is more opulent than the last. The park is beautiful and the fountain must be fantastic when it is in operation. Winter has its charms too, the canal down to the sea was frozen and so was the water by the beach.

Don't belive advice of 3 days in St.Peterburg (again). I was here in March. Now i think i don't want go back because In March this place is bad! It was gray and sad. Gold was look like plastic. Water was dirty.
People, go there only in summer!

Impressive palace great location. Beautiful palace in a great location. Rooms are well worth visiting with gold and chandeliers. Hard to believe the building was completely rebuilt after the war. Grounds are second to none with spectacular fountains and views over the gulf of Finland ...must see palace

“Luxurious & extrvagant”. This is one of the most famous and popular attractions of St. Petersburg’s. It is around 29 kilometres away from St. Petersburg so you’ll need to arrange transportation. We went there early in the morning. We enjoyed the place with fewer people. Each room has its own theme and individual design. All are very luxurious, it‘s hard to imagine the extrvagant lifestyle of the emperors and empresses. Inside no cameras are allowed. The gardens and fountains are another jaw dropping sight, it’s so elegant. On our day of visit, the fountain didn’t turn on for special event later, but I didn’t mind, I can see the art works more clearly. Happy Travelling!
Wow!. My fiancé, (Russian), took me here as a day trip. I could not believe how beautiful it is here. Gold, gold and more gold!

Gorgeous Garden. The Grand Palace is absolutely gorgeous. The park is beautiful. Prepare to do a bit a walking. I was pregnant, but it was doable. My grandmother and mother-in-law had a bit of trouble with all the stairs and walking, but there were plenty of benches for them.
A great afternoon. I spent the afternoon strolling about the grounds. The fountains are beautiful and the gardens gave a huge variety of flowers which are all displayed so beautifully.

Spend more time in the park!. The best time to go there is on a good, summer, sunny day, otherwise there will be no sense going there. Do not go to the little additional exhibitions, which have long waiting lines, and expensive additional tickets, there is nothing better to see there than the fountains and the park. So enjoy the time at the park.

Very soviet-like museum with poor management. Visited the palace in June 2015. Had to wait in a long line with tour groups periodically getting in front of us. It was difficult to enjoy the museum with the employees constantly rushing us through the gallery. The museum is a narrow gallery of gala rooms which should take about 30-40 minutes to walk through, due to the crowds and poor management it took us about 1.5 hours to visit (+1 hour in line) and find ourselves in the tourist trap souvenir shop as the only exit to the park. My advice: spend more time in the park and visit a smaller palace in the Lower fountain park rather than losing time in line to go inside the Grand Palace.

Peterhof, one great sight after another, Grand Buildings with Wonderful Gardens. We arrived at the Peterhof, Grand Palace before it opened and got ahead of the crowds, however they did catch up with us. There are a number of palaces on the grounds and there are wonderful and ornate fountains and beautiful flowering gardens everywhere. We timed our explore so that we were at the Grand Cascade just before it was turned on for the day. Seeing it come to life was absolutely great. We were impressed to learn that there are no pumps providing water pressure but and elaborate system of piping from large spring fed holding pools let gravity do the work, very clever engineering, ingenious… The Palace is a bit of a drive from the city. There are some steps involved in walking the grounds and the grounds go on forever so be prepared for a nice walk in the park. There were many international visitors there with us and capturing the pictures we wanted required a bit of patience but no worries, we were no disappointed. Our advice is to visit the Peterhof if you can!
need to come back in summer. to bad it was still cold this time of the year, we missed the fountains, but enjoyed the nice walk about the gardens. We arranged a taxi for a return trip of ~2000 rub.
It's one of the most amazing places in the world!. It is suitable for everybody. You'll definetelly enjoy this place. Full of impressive fountains with cosy alleys and paths help you to relax.

Really nice place for visit. Just take the right time for your visit - between May and August, good weather and you wouln't be disappointed. Grand Palace, as well as some smaller palaces and mansions are just wonderfull. Add a number of fountains all imaginable forms and sizes (this place often called just like "fountains of Petergoff") and magnificent parks - Upper and Lower ones, with a lot of flowers, panoramic Finnish gulf view... The palace itself actually consists of 3 of 4 buildings and worth for visit also. Come early for not to spend much time in a queue. Be prepare some of warm cloth, it could be a wind from the gulf.

Bling, bling bling. This was one eye opener to the use of gold leaf both inside and out. As we went in March, the fountains were not running but they were being uncovered to be serviced ready for switching on next month. The garden looked sad, but nothing looks good with dirty melting snow and were still interesting to wander round. The interiors were spectacular. White walls and gold leaf on any surface nailed down. With mirrored rooms, the impressions were magnificent. Again going in March, we practically had the place to ourselves. You could easily imagine war and peace scenes going on here.

PARADISE IN ST. PETERSBURG. The Grand Palace at Peterhof was designed to be the centerpiece of Peter the Great's "Russian Versaille". Around 1720The Grand Palace is not the only historic royal building in Peterhof. The palaces of Monplaisir and Marly, as well as the pavilion known as the 'Hermitage', were all raised during the initial construction of Peterhof during the reign of Peter the Great. The Lower Gardens also contain a large greenhouse, and in the Alexandrine Park stands the palace of Nicholas I.

An impressive reconstruction. The Summer palace of Peter the Great is located south of Saint Petersburg at the shore of Baltic sea. An impressive building overlooking the gardens at the lower level with water fountains dancing at the rhythm of ‎music when it's time for the program. A water channel approximately half a mile connects the gardens to the Baltic sea. The palace itself is not original. The original was destroyed by German occupational forces prior to their retreat. However the curators where able to move most of the paintings and the furnitures prior to German occupation. After the war the palace was rebuilt using the best available craftsmen and the ‎salvaged paintings and decorations were reinstated in the building. May not be original but it gives an accurate impression of the times. Pictures in the interior are not allowed but the gardens offer some of the best shoots you can take.
Grand Palace. Must go while in St Petersburg! Beautiful Palace with Grand Architecture and a huge sprawling estate. If interested do travel back to city by ferry.

Great Peter The Great Palace. It take around 1 hour by car to get into the location from the city of St Peterburg, but the destination is worth the trip.You can see an amazing ballroom, which are covering by gold, you can also can see how the people from that time doing their activity daily, of course by looking at all the room there.The word, don't touch will be always said by guard of museum, but don't worry, that because they want to keep the building clean....Outside you can see the sea, and also a canal that Peter the Great can directly go to the sea from his palace.Unfortundtely at winter the water fountain are not working.

Summer is the real fun in Peterhof. I had visited many times to Peterhof as I'm living in Saint Petersburg Best time to visit is from May -October It's a great show with fountains,palaces and gardens Must try the hydrofoil ride from Petersburg to Peterhof
Its worth the effort. This will take a little effort to get to but its worth it. We took a boat to the Palace. The gardens are well maintained and a peaceful retreat.
Beautiful. Beautiful palace, gold is everywhere! We came here on a winter day and it was very cold and windy, but still we visited the garden which is great.
An Amazing Palace and Beatifully Restored. The Palace is beautifully restored and a must visit. We took a boat ride from the center of the city.

Palace. We visited this Summer Palace as part of our 2 day guided tour of St Petersburg. One should take the time to walk through the gardens which have statues and fountains. The main fountain display is not to be missed.

Impressive!!!. Lovely and impressive especially the fountains and the gardens however the place is overcrowded with tourist since it is the month of August- summer. The interiors of the palace is full of interesting pieces that characterised splendour and grandeur during the old times. Want to go back there again someday.

Astonishing and must see it. It was absolutely top i have seen so fat. I like a lot more if i compare to Louvre. I took a train to Moskovskaya station which was very easy and cost only Rb 35 and then took markutska number 535 from that station. When you get out of station in Moskovskay follow sign Bus to airport otherwise you can get lost. I paid another rb35 to get to station Puskin. Please tell driver to inform you otherwise hard to know that you are there as bus continue further. I bought ticket and went with group for group tour. It was amazing and i learn a lot. There is so much gold on walls and all is in such amazing conditions. As it is winter now and a lot less tourist we did get to some parts and rooms which are normally closed during summer. After tour you still have a chance to go on your own. After i did some walks across the gardens and i cant wait to come back during summer. It must be amazing.in most rooms you can take photo without flash. It takes 1/2 day to do both palace and park.

Probably one of the highlights of our St. Peterburg visit. We visited Peterhof early on the first morning of our 2 day St. Petersburg visit. We travelled there on one of the hydrofoils that whizz in and out of the harbour and that was an experience itself! After arriving at Peterhof, we walked for a couple of hours around the gardens and saw most of the 150 fountains in all their glory. The whole complex is a wonderful blend of gardens and fountains with a spectacular staircase of fountains that lead to the palace itself. A very enjoyable visit!
Residence. Fresh air, super sites. Feelings of being an emperess. Many museums. Wonderful conllections, incredible fountains.
Stunning. the vast expanse of this well organized palace ground. Stunning. Can be very windy (and cold), hence jackets & good shoes recommended.

Feel a part of a Russian history!. If you travel in summer time, choose 1 day to visit Petergof! When all fountains work, everything blossoms, and while walking along the paths, you feel like a part of a history. some centuries ago tzars were walking the same routs! Fascinating experience! By the way, the best and fastest way to get there is by water.

Russian Versailles . You need to take the hydrofoil outside of the Hermitage and it will take 30 to 40 minutes to get there. There is then a bit of a walk along the waterways, before arriving at the bottom of the steps. Take a minute to drink in the splendour of the fountains and hopefully they are fully operating on the day you go. Then it is up to the top of the stairs to get your tickets and there are always queues and a lack of signposts as to which queue you should be in, so make sure you check.There is a point around mid day when the Palace closes, which seems very strange in this day and age. We opted to do the church, which although was another cost, it was nominal and worth a look, as it is stunning.The main palace takes a while to get into with the various levels security. Once inside you are herded through, so not a lot of time to soak in all of the contents. A big issue was very noisy groups of Chinese.For me the beauty of this place is in the church and outside when the fountains are flowing. You can also take a walk through the wooded area and you will find several places to eat, nothing startling, but okay.

Just Amazing!. On September 4th 2015 my wife and I visited Peterhof Palace with our SPB guide Deetrie. We were there early in the morning at 10:00 am to witness the opening of the fountains with a musical theme. We toured the upper and lower landscaped gardens with all the fountains and sculptures. The marvelous Great Palace with the Grand Cascade and golden statues is the centre piece of it all. After we had a nice lunch at the park’s restaurant Brynza & Shashlyk Peterhof. We would rate this Peterhof tour as a five (5) stars and would recommend it to our friends and family wishing to visit.

A true competitor of Versailles. The gardens, the fountains and the location on the river are superior to what Versailles has to offer. The palace itself has definitely more refinement. All in all not to miss while visiting St. Petersburg
Very nice place. I went to Russia last summer and I visited this wonderful place. So impressive and full of history ! I really recommend this if you have to visit one and only palace

ab fab. Went early ,to beat the crowds, even before the fountains had started up..obviously amazing place, but I loved the gardens the best and the walk down to the ocean..little squirrels running up to us for a snack..so cute.. the fountains..well what can you say..the photos give a small idea of there magnificence

Peter the great's summer bungalow. Well they say the façade of the palace has 100 kilos of gold in decorations. So much' that legend has it that Catherine the great, coming home in the afternoon after a hunt , thought the palace was on fire due to the reflections on the gold from the sun.Beautiful gardens in the summer. all the fountains were designed to be gravity fed, so no pumps were used. Inside has been fully restored after the Germans bombed and pillaged the place. most of the treasures were moved to Siberia for safe keeping. The eighth wonder of the world, is said to be the The famous Amber room. the entire four walls were decorated with different colored amber mined in Siberia. During theGerman occupation they built false walls to cover the amber, but the Germans knew of the room and eventually found the false walls and removed all the amber. the room was meticulously restored from photos.
Great. The Palace and the gardens are just beautiful. If you have some days, try to find a sunny day to visit it!!

The best palace for the whole world. Even when the weather not so good it is a Grand Palace.In nice weather all is sparkling and shining. Really the gold is all over. All is covering by gold. Clean, nice and comfortable parks. Many rides and history. A dream comes thru. Very good inside, all full of history. Comfortable visit and the memory will stay with you forever. Waterfalls are delightful.

Fantastic. This palace is so beautiful, we were lucky to see the water fountains still working, because they are off in winter. Visited on a sunny but chilly day. Inside its breathtaking, this is a must in the city. Don't miss it.

Simply Magnificent. We arranged for a 2 day tour of St Petersburg and this was on the itinerary. What a truly amazing place, it is very easy to see why there was a revolt by the lower classes.I think that we spent about 2 hours on the tour, the gardens and the fountains alone were well worth the visit. Walking is ok if you are fairly fit but be warned there a many stairs to contend with. Some of the people on our trip were unable to handle the stairs.Our tour guide was brilliant and had a great sense of humour and yes, he was Russian!
Full of stories and architecture.... Full of stories and architecture...great venue in SP, loved the gardens and mix of people visiting. History at it's best!
No words!. Wonderful palace and amazing, huge, garden with fountains and statues. This is place you have to know in Russia.

When you rule the world. The Grand Palace was basically a shipping port turned into a fortress/palace. There are over 150 fountains and countless gold-gilded statues which look absolutely fantastic and shiny. The surrounding park is very well kept and the area is full of small sized wild-life too. You could have a peaceful and leisurely stroll to soak in all the views since it is surrounded by a body of water. It is an hour's drive from the heart of Saint Petersburg but absolutely worth the drive down. The culture is rich and magnificent in all parts of Russia.

The magnificent Palace.. The Grand Palace — the main building of the Palace and Park ensemble "Peterhof" located in the same city on the southern coast of the Gulf of Finland in Petrodvortsovy district of the Federal city of St. Petersburg. Was almost completely destroyed during the Second world war, in 1952 restored. View of the facade of the Grand Palace from the Upper or Lower parks is impressive, but the Palace is quite narrow and not so big as it looks. Has approx. 30 rooms, including the lavishly decorated state rooms, plastered marble, with painted ceilings, inlaid parquet floors and gilded walls. Original modest Royal Palace, built in the style of "Peter's Baroque" in 1714-1725 by the project of I. Braunstein, J. B. Le blond, and then N. The Michetti, was rebuilt (1745-1755) by Elizabeth on the model of Versailles (architect. F. B. Rastrelli), in the so-called Baroque. The length of the façade which faces the sea — 268 m. Is part of the State art and architectural Palace and Park Museum-reserve "Peterhof".

Amazing!. Amazing! The park is really beautiful! I enjoyed the walk! The only problem I had is with finding food as it was overcrowded, so I suggest to pack some snacks! Other than that, amazing! Make sure to take the excursion inside of the fountains, to get the perspective of how it all works.

Felt wonderful to walk the grounds . The views of the grand palace and grounds are a site to see. The architecture is great. We did a two day tour and enjoyed every part of the 17 hours through out St Petersburg. Nothing missed. This was one of the best sites.

A Hard Gig in Winter. Peterhof looks like it would shine in Summer. Winter is a different story. The parks are naturally bleak in winter which only leaves you with the Palace and museums. The Palace is impressive but only 30 rooms and if you are not with a tour group you're going to do it tough. It seems 90% of their business comes from tour groups so they just don't gear up for individual travellers.We have generally experienced reasonable hospitality on our Russian trip but Peterhof staff are still in the Soviet era. Ask a question in English and you will get brushed aside.If you are going there not as part of a group please do your research and don't rely on too much help there.

Great place to visit, full of history and richness.. This is a very nice palace with a wonderful garden/park. The park has a nice collection of statues/fountains, but the palace is also an art masterpiece.
Beautiful!. Went to Peterhof on a beautiful July day. I have been to Versailles and I can´t decide which one I like better! Definitely go there if you are in St. Petersburg!

A heavenly place.. Very beautiful place, nice garden, nice views, picturesque scenes, the sculptures had done very very hard work to make the Golden statues all around. Will visit again I will get chance to go Russia.

Incredible palace. The most beautiful place i've ever seen. I went in winter and was already incredible, I want go now in summer, because I dream with all the sources between the Poseidon's sculptures. And I want to know how is the window for the ocident without the snow.

Are you ready for more..... If you haven´t got enough of grand palaces and felt breathless to take in all the beauty from the times of zars and Russian nobility.Peterhof lies some 20 km away from the city and I would recommend to take a taxi, that saves you a lot of time. We had hired a private guide , it was a good investment as she could tell all the history of Peterhof and led us to the most important things,The Main Staircase, The Ballroom and The Throne Room are SO impressive , you can stay and watch and feel inside a fairytale.The main attraction of Peterhof is the park and the fountains. Unfortunately we arrived too late in autumn to see them in function, they were closed for winter.But if you have been to Versailles you can get the idea, just that Peterhof is bigger. There are so many fountains and statues in that well tended park.Admire the Great Cascade with all golden statues and look down the canal leading the waters from The Great Cascade to the Finnish Gulf. The guide told us that the water for the fountains arrives from 20 kilometers away! You also could sail up the canal from the sea,what a grand way to arrive to Peterhof.Even we did miss the water show it was enjoyable to walk in that great park. I am positive that this is one of the sights not to miss .Hope you will enjoy it as much as we did,

Never Let A Bad Experience Ruin Your Trip. Just last week, I and my friend decided to visit Peterhof Palace while in Saint Petersburg. We studied the map en route by Metro from Nevsky to Avtovo and van to Peterhof.The palace grounds were not as alive at they would be during summers and the water features were not working. Although I have walked in the gardens of Versailles one summer, I appreciate the splendour of Peterhof this winter. Cold. Stunningly beautiful.Our bad experience was at Avtovo. While going down to the platform on our way home, two officers stopped us to see our passports. We showed our passports with visa from DUBAI MOSCOW Consulate! Not enough, they asked us to enter a small room and checked EVERYTHING in our pockets and bags! One man even picked out and counted the Dollars and Dirhams of our wallets! Unbelievable officers (are these people guarding the metro station policemen?). I was so shocked seeing him counting my Dollars and Dirhams right before my eyes. To cut the story short, when we stepped out of that tiny room, I lost one 100 DOLLAR BILL. May God have mercy on their souls. Should this be how tourists get treated? Those two officers should have asked directly 100 Dollars from me instead of pilfering me at my face. Though it's just money I have earned from hard work in Dubai, I am in utter disbelief as to how can they bear the thought of eating something from that stolen money or, worse, provide to their families.Travellers, be extra careful when out and about in Saint Petersburg. Better leave foreign currency in your hotel / hostel safety boxes.I still liked Saint Petersburg despite of this.

A must visit being at St. Petersburg. The palace is an exceptional work of art, architecture and engineering.It amazes with the views and any visit to St. Petersburg is incomplete without visit of Peterhof palace.

Best place in Petersburg. its a wonderful place and it has many things to visit also you can enjoy nature and great weather especially in Aug after that you can back to center by some fast boat and enjoy the view

Russian Versailles. These Palace and gardens are sometime considered the "Russian Versailles".Beautiful and amazing gardens, nice springs. Mandatory, you have to find a time to visit this marvelous place.

engineering marvel. Here at the Peterhof one must see the cascades and surrounding fountains and other awe inspired sites.The fountains and statues are all mind blowing.Many o f the fountains work on gravity alone.

Classic Art. You can travel form Petersburg to Petergof by electric train, it will be cheap. You can als travel there by motor boat via the Gulf of Finland. The fountains and the garden are really stunning, as well as the view of the Gulf! Do not think that it is worth visiting museum if you are here during the tourist season.
Fantastic Fountains. Try to time your visit to midday as fountains not turned on till then, considerable amount of walking.
A Jewel in St Petersburg. This was my favorite attraction in St Petersburg. The grounds are magnificent and the fountains breathtaking. A must see.

Beautiful garden and palace. To get here there are options, by train/car or one can take Hydrofoil, which the last one was my chosen transportation as it's faster, less hassle although it's more expensive (RUB 1200 for vv ride).Additional ticket needed to see inside the palace, so there are 2 tickets; to enter the garden and to enter the palace, make sure you have both in your hands before you join the long queue to enter the palace.No picture taking is allowed inside the palace.

Very nice and beautiful architecture. You can easily spend an entire day here, it's massive. Take a walk through the gardens, and go into the palace if you're able to. I spent several hours walking around here, it's a really lovely place to be.

amazing even when the water is off. amazing place even when the water is turned off for the winter. i must say go during the months the water is running but if you get the chance it is worth the time to go out and see and take the public transportation its cheap and easy to navigate even for a dumb american like me
Breath taking. A most if your visiting St Petersburg, get there for 11am for the music and fountains. Got there by Hydrofoil which was great.

Peter's Greatness!. We had been wanting to visit St. Petersburg for a long time and seeing Peterhof was at the top of the list. We were not disappointed. The baroque architecture and artwork reflected in the palace is stunning. Do not dare to compare this to Versailles; the locals get very upset about this (or there was any influence altogether). We were there during summer so we were able to see the fountains. A summer visit is a must to see them and make sure to be there at noon to hear the music! Allow enough time to tour the gardens and grounds because they are beautiful. Peter was apparently quite the jokester and there are some fountains that spray passersby with water, unknowingly. Be warned! The only downside was not being allowed to take pictures inside. Otherwise, a definite must see in St. Petersburg! Make sure to take the hydrofoil there from the city. The ride is a sightseeing trip as well!

Impressive. True masterpiece of Soviet achitecture and a must visit in St.Petersburg.Beautiful gardens and fountains.. I couldn't be impressed with grandeur. However, this meets, exceeds, and is over the top! The fountains and cascades were incredible. The playful "sprays" were also lots of fun. Would have liked to see an evening light show with music and, perhaps, fireworks. Book ahead

"Versailles by the Sea". This magnificent Paterhof Palace shows you opulent mirrored rooms decorated with paintings & gilded wooden carvings. From the great marble terrace one can see the famed Grand Cascade, made up a three waterfalls, 64 fountains and 37 statues. After the tour of the palace, enjoy a walk thru the beautiful gardens.

beautiful day!. what a amazing place. the grounds are just beautiful. the fountains start at 11, it's best to get there before they start. Be aware that the fountains are shut down the end of the summer, our early September visit was one of the last with full fountains. The palace is open for groups and natives at certain times, so be sure to check and be there when you will be allowed entrance. Again, very crowded, take care to put yourself between groups so you can move more freely. By half way through we were finding ourselves in rooms with no one else. Take your time and enjoy all this amazing estate has to offer. Hopefully you will have wonderful weather to visit in.

Take a tour. Quite a drive out from St Petersburg but really worth the trip.Could easily spend a whole day, pack a picnic and enjoy in the gardens. The grounds and fountains are stunning.The Palace itself is heavily restored or recreated due to damage and looting from wars and revolution. It really captures the essence of what the Palace used to be and is well looked after by the staff now. Stunning and a must see! They also require you to cover your shoes with little covers so it can get slippery at times inside!

Awful with handicapped!. If you are handicapped this is not a good choice. Had back surgery recently (9 weeks ago) and need to help myself with a cane, first zero English or other language spoken, they did not allow me use my cane inside the museum, the offer a wheelchair which I accepted, wheelchair is a joke there is only stairs no elevator, I asked the staff how am I supposed to go upstairs the great answer that I got from them " carry your chair", are they serious!!!I already paid my ticket, paid an expensive ride from my hotel to the palace, so I said to myself you can do the stairs! To make it harder the made me use some shoe bags, doctor's shoe covers type, which made it so dangerous for me it was pretty slippery, I complained, and answer was that sorry but I could leave, and of course they do not refund your money. Some other guest pretty nice people offered to help me. I saw a disabled kid that need a wheelchair and his dad had to carry him.Exhibition I do not know if it is because is October, off peak season but just a few rooms were opened..... Big disappointment!
Grande Palace. fantastic area with fountain, big green areawalk a lot in this areavery clearly, diferent, take a lot of pictures
Good for tourist escape summer time. Located at a distance from the city, the park palace and Russian competitiour to the Versailles it is a nice to be seen if you have spare half a day

Wonderful on a nice weather day. This is a great day trip taking one of the hydrofoils from in front of the Hermitage museum. Be sure to pick a nice day as there is lots of outside walking with an extensive wooded park and several other buildings and gardens in additional to the great palace. The fountains are astounding. I did not see the palace interior which I understand is very nice as there was an enormous line to get in and my hubby is disabled.

Peterhof - St.Petersburg. Amazing place with beautiful huge parks, trees, fountains, all green everywhere, and very clean, breathtaking view to the Gulf of Finland..Can't describe by words..One of "must visit" places !!! Better go on the last day - about September 12.. closing spectacular show...!!

Don't go after season. I was there after the closure of season and was totally a waste of time and money. The fountains don't work and they have no audio guide in English or any other language than russian.
Very Grand. Another building not to be missed, another one to be viewed with a guide who can explain the history of the Palace
No 1 place to see in St. Petersburg. Grand Palace is a must see palace when visiting St. Petersburg. Both palace inside and gardens outside are grand and beautiful, keeping in very nice condition.

Absolutely stunning! A masterpiece on all levels.. A must visit which is about 45 minutes out of St. Petersburg. Completely renovated as it was destroyed by Hitler's troops after the Siege of Leningrad. A must to see. We had a four hour tour, including driving time and would recommend a longer tour. Excellent gift shop where we bought our first amber jewelry.

"Better" than Winter Palace. The rooms at the Peterhof Grand Palace are beautifully preserved and really give you a feel of what life would have been like for the royal family at Peterhof. And of course the gardens and fountains don't need any recommendation. Unfortunately you can't take photos, and our tour was in Russian which we didn't understand ... we enjoyed it anyway.
The Grand Palace is amazing. Despite that the palace was hurt through out the wars, is one of the most impressive monuments in St. Petersburg, do not miss the gardens

Just Amazing. A dream come true to visit this outstanding Palace of the Czars. The bus ride from St Petersburg is about 1hr 10 mins. Painted a spectacularl yellow & white with gold domes. It is so large that it is hard to believe people actually lived here. When you see something gold it was real gold. This was designed and decorated more for men and the hunt. It is really hard to tell that as the opulence is still there. When you walk up the main staircase the stairs are really short and that is because the women's dresses weighed at least 40 pounds so they had to take small steps and couldn't lift there dresses and walk gracefully at the same time. The use of gold is so over whelming that you can see why there was an uprising when their people saw this wealth and huge homes that were built for the rich and they themselves were starving. The house is better done with a guide as you learn more about the lives of the people that lived here and the history. Mainly people from all over Europe were the main craftsmen. Our tour guides name was Julia and she was a walking encyclopedia. After the tour she suggested that we talk a walk in the grounds. At 11:30 am they turn on the main water cascade and fountains. The display is set to music just unbelievable. There are so many people lining the stairways and walkways to see the main event that it is hard to get near to take a pictures. If you wait until the end of the music you can get great pics without people being in your pic or at least not many. The grounds are extensive. You can walk down the canal toward the Baltic sea and go over each of the little bridges that look back towards the house. There are also side walkways that have more statues and fountains. The gardens are so beautifully done and maintained, you saw people cleaning and sweeping everywhere. It was high on my list of to do things and it did not disappoint at all.

So beautiful n unique. There are some palaces in this fascinating garden ,but I do like its fountains n status ;I never seen something like this before :Beautiful classic status situated on stairs between fountains ,don't miss it.
Grand indeed! . Another fabulous Palace, with beautiful fountains, gardens and views of the sea. Definitely worth the trip to the country.

Grand and refreshing. FIrst up, the Russians did a great job restoring the palace. No surprise that it is their pride and joy. We really enjoyed the water features which are an important part of the palace compound, seeing that the fountains lead out to the Gulf of Finland. Especially so as we visited the palace on a hot summer's day. No surprise that it was Peter the Great's summer residence.Of course, as a favourite tourist attraction, it is tremendously crowded, but compared to the other tourist hotspot in St Petersburg, the Hermitage, I never felt suffocated or trapped inside. This is probably because you have to move in groups, so you won't be allowed to roam on your own even if you came on your own. Also, the staff are very conscientious about ensuring one group doesn't stay in one room for too long, to keep the traffic moving along. A bit strict, but it really makes the experience better for everyone. Also made easier by the fact that you aren't allowed photos.Definitely worth a visit.

Water Water Everywhere. Place was trashed by the Nazi's. Unbelievable restoration job. Fountains are a sight to behold. A lovely place to take a stroll around the grounds. Take lots of pictures. Nice to be Tsar.
Paradise on Earth. There is no language on the earth to say about this excellent structure. Its a paradise on earth and one needs to visit to enjoy it.

Beautiful gardens with many fountains. We went as a group and were just in time for the fountains to be opened with music playing. We wandered through the gardens and enjoyed the lovely surroundings with a good local guide.
My favourite. This is such a beautiful property and grounds to match all with a lake view . You could spend an entire day here

Versailles by the Sea. Peterhof, the legacy of Peter the Great and his French architect Alexander Jean Baptiste LeBlond, is simply stunning. Peter the Great’s grand palace was extensively enlarged by his daughter the Empress Elizabeth and later, renovated by his granddaughter in law Catherine the Great. But, for me, the gardens, fountains and other water features are what make Peterhof so special - from the grand cascades to the mischievous trick fountains. Perched right on the Gulf of Finland within the gardens is Mon Plaisir where, according to biographer Robert Massie, ‘the restless monarch found tranquillity’. The only sour note during our most recent visit was the pushing and shoving by people dressed in period costume in an attempt to monopolise the photo opportunity at the Statue of Samson.

What an estate! The Garden and fountains are simply outstanding! I was speechless...... Audio or guided tour will offer the best all-around experience, The fountains are original, and the gardens are well planned, great place to stroll and take more pictures. The grandeur of this palace left me speechless. The tour started inside and was good, but the most memorable part was walking to the 'backyard" and seeing the fountains and waterfalls.

Grand it is!. Beautifully landscaped, fantastic fountains and awe inspiring views-this palace truly is grand. You could spend hours here walking around the grounds and taking it all in without even stepping foot inside the palace. It is takes your breath away.
Better then Versal😢. Very big and impressive.Gourges park and beautiful.fontans.But.Make sure that will no winds....Boat from center 45 minAttractive cost.Food in the park not so good.

WOW!!!. To think this is all restored post WWll is amazing and must have cost hundreds of millions. The gardens are beautiful and the interior breathtaking. Like nothing you've ever seen. Take the hydrofoil out from St. Petersburg for the grand effect of the view as you walk up from river.

Amazing Renovation. Peter's Palace was almost completely destroyed by the Germans in WWII. Nothing much was left but the vertical walls. The Russians have done a great job restoring the Palace to its czarist grandeur. Not completely, of course, as this is a massive undertaking. But the grounds as well as the palace itself are a great destination. Recommend the hydrofoil ride from St. Petersburg, rather than the car ride; the town itself is still pretty drab, so not a very scenic drive. Gilded halls, fountains, and artwork for the ages. Very much worth the trip!

The Garden and Fountains Are The Reason To Visit. The palace itself, which was commissioned by Czar Peter the Great, is interesting enough, but in a sense its interior falls into the category of just another opulent European palace. What makes a trip to Peterhof really special are the palace's grounds and fountains, which can be described as spectacular. The fountains are visually stunning, but are all the more remarkable for the fact that they operate solely by means of natural hydraulic pressure--in other words, no pumps! The palace grounds border the Baltic Sea, and it's worth taking the 20 minute round trip stroll from the palace to the sea and back to catch a glimpse of the sea.
Really Grand. Grand Palace Peterhof, St. Petersburg is worth visiting. It is really a Grand Palace surrounded by spatular gardens.
See it.. It's okay on the inside. Far more impressive on the outside. The gardens and water fountains are great!

Amazing Estate, more fountains than rome. Seriously the best day city excursion I've ever made while traveling. endless gardens and lakes, and flowers, and sculptures. Possibly the most romantic and refreshing place, while breeze coming off the sea. A must do, worth flying all the way to russia just for this!

The Russian Versailles - an absolute stunner!. In order to understand the former glory of Russian aristocracy there is no way avoiding Peterhof. Nicknamed as the Russian Versailles one quickly sees the comparison between these two landmarks as the abundance of gold, gardens and architectural beauty will not leave you careless. The location is fairly easy accessible by boat, making a it a perfect trip for 4-8 hours, depending on whether you are looking to get inside the palace. We skip the inner tour as there were legions of people waiting out front for entry, so if you want to get the full Peterhof experience make sure to come either early on a business day or plan to spend the whole day.Whether you to plan to visit the inside or not - Peterhof is a spectacular sight and must visit spot when visiting beautiful St. Petersburg!

Winter palace . Low park , best option . The entrance to the park, which you can get through internet in advance, is all you need to get. Inside places don't seem so impressive.Be prepare for walking a lot and take cash with you.Best option is going by boat. You can get the first way with card but return is only bought in the palace with cash.The journey through the river deserves the boat trip and is the best if you don't speak Russian.

Water Fountain Paradise. One thing for sure about St Petersburg is that it confirms that the Russian Royalty knew how to build palaces with the 'wow!' factor. This palace had water fountains scattered throughout the extensive gardens. It was another stunning place to explore and be amazed by.

Crowded but well worth it. This incredibly opulent palace is located outside of St. Petersburg but worth the short drive from the city (you also drive by Putin's palace). The inside of the house is opulent, with many of the original items, including Peter the Greats private area. The best part about Peterhoff is the gardens, with enormous amount of elaborate fountains, from gold plated stairs, to fake trees. They are all timed together. If you come, YOU MUST GET THERE IN THE MORNING. If you have the chance, come as early as possible, before the crowds get out of control. I promise that you will thank me.

Beautiful but pricey. The palace is beautiful but if you go to hermitage it's so much more beautiful and interesting. They don't allow pictures inside.
