As a result I have almost no memory of any of the rooms.Once we were finished with the tour we had to return to the coat check area to retrieve our checked items. The chaos had gotten worse due to the totally disorganized system. Everyone entering and exiting the coat check area had to go through one single doorway. There were at least 200 people crammed in one small room and it took at least one half hour to make it to the counter and then back through the same door. I was elbowed and shoved several times by extremely frustrated people.Once we exited the building we took a quick peek at the gardens. It was still pouring rain so we could only see a short distance into them, but what we could see looked lovely.The Peterhof was totally restored after it was destroyed by the Germans during the Siege of Leningrad during WWII so it has a bit of a "stage set" feeling to it. The terrible weather and the disorganization really impacted our impression of the Peterhof and our experience might have been totally different if the weather had been better.

Fountains. It was a cool and very windy day when we came off the hydrofoil and walked up to the gardens. The fountains are glittering and beautiful. It is hard to believe that so much of it was destroyed during the WW2.

Take a camera. We went on a lovely sunny day , the fountains with the background of the Palace are incredible ,we took a packed lunch and were part of a guided tour ,but had plenty of free time to wander and take photos, the views from the top of the steps near the fountains are well worth a climb up.we got the hydrofoil back to the Hermitage from the jetty, a memorable day excusion

LIKE VERSAILLES, A MUST SEE. Yes, the Czar's Summer Palace is ornate and luxurious, in that "you've got to be kidding me" sort of way. Take your time. Rest along the way - it's a LOT to see. You can get a good glimpse in a couple of hours, but it's worth an entire day to relax in the gardens and have lunch.It's always worth seeing how the one-hundredth-of-the-One Percent lived. After all, you realize that the great equalizer eventually brings us all together - some not as peacefully as others. My favorite here (nominal extra charge, but DO IT) is the "Little Hermitage" - a small house where honored guests from foreign lands were entertained. The centerpiece, aside from the art and the view on the Baltic Sea, is a mechanical dining table straight out of Leonardo's (or de Sade's?) imagination. The Rube Goldberg-worthy contraption lowers all the plates down a couple of floors to the kitchen, where staff (who couldn't be trusted to mingle with the higher-and-mightier) loaded the food into perfectly aligned positions, then crancked the entire thing upwards into the waiting arms of the cognoscenti (please keep your pinky fingers extended at all times, dahling). One can't help but marvel, but it helps to do so with tongue firmly planted in cheek.Yet the very best part of Peterhof are the gardens - with sculpture and design (not to mention ingenious plumbing) second to none on Earth, provided in loving measure by the French, the Italians, and the Germans. Not necessarily in that order.You can take a bus here from the Avtova Metro Station or from just in front of the Baltiskiy Railroad station. It's not far, and you'll get a better view of the suburban environs for the miniscule fare. But be sure to take the hydrofoil boat back to town from the dock at Peterhof. The approximately $15 one-way ticket is well worth the ride and the different view from the Baltic sea.If you rented one of the digital players that tell you about all the exhibits in various languages (recommended) you can return it and get your cash deposit back near the dock, without returning to the front entrance.Don't miss it.
A disappointment. Hot and crowded inside and out; not worth the trip. Don't expect Versailles; instead, overgrown grass and dandelions, eh fountains.

Rewarding. After the boat landed at the pier we were in awe of the veiw of this majestic palace. As we approached it just got better. We walked through the beautiful grounds of fountains, gardens and waterfeatures. The winter palace was a must see also. If you can just do it!
Amazing. This to me is the best thing you could ever see.it is out of the way a bit but well worth the drive out.An absolute must on the list.

Don't miss this. I've seen a lot of palaces and castles, but this one beats them all. Keep your camera ready because there are so many great photo opps. Take your time seeking the best possible ones. Be sure to ask about the trick fountains and it is worth going back to see it on a sunny day. We were lucky.

Condemned to do it with a tour. A rather expensive but quick boat ride will get you from the Hermitage to Peterhof (1200rb return per adult).The place is amazing and extremely nice.Unfortunately you pay to enter the site and any museum/place you wish to visit on top.Although you could easily be satisfied with the general access your entry fee gives you, the Palace is a must to visit.To our great disappointment, only the 'tours' were given access to the Palace and you have to wait and fight your way in after 16h15 to get in ! (And pay). I don't know if this goes on every day but I must say it is unacceptable.But the place is so great....so call in advance or get in with the other umbrella followers....

Better than expected. I new about Peterhof Palace all my life, but this was a first time I was in st. Petersburg in summer - absolutely must see (try to spend there at least 6 hours) - I was there with excursion for 3 hours and that was just enough to see the palace, so the fountains was sightseeing on the run.

Absolutely beautiful. This palace is absolutely beautiful and amazing!We took the hydrofoil to visit through Alla Tours after getting here via cruise ship!Very nice to walk around! Get here during the summer when the fountains are on - at any sign of frost they shut them off!

Has the Wow Factor - leave yourself plenty of time. St Petersburg - Peterhof Palace and gardens. The gardens are spectacular 15 fountains in all, gravity fed. Just magnificent. The palace is also a wonderful piece of architecture and the contents are some of the best you will ever see. We were on a tour with serious time constraints and regret not doing the gardens and the palace justice. Exacerbated by the apparent disorganised security system. Have no problem with security in wonderful places such as the Peterhof palace. The difficulty arises in actually getting into the palace and if you have a jacket and or large bag they need to be handed into the cloak room. The area where you hand in your coat and/or bag is in a very narrow area of the palace. People trying to hand in their belongings and others trying to pick them up. So be prepared for long queues and claustrophobic environment. Once through all this, the palace is magnificent. Taking of photos is prohibited. But leave plenty of time to see it all as it covers a vast area. It is worth it.

must go..... Wonderful experience, culture, nature and history...i would advice to take tours, which are affordable and well organized, a bit rude:) but do not pay attention, just enjoy the trip, take some food with you:)

Amazing Fountains. The fountains at the Peterhof have to be seen to be believed. We arrived in time for the switch on at 11am to musical accompaniment. After this we wandered up to the palace and joined the queue. Fortunately a helpful tour courier pointed out that we were in the queue for the groups and it turned out that there were no tickets available to individual visitors until 4.15 in the afternoon. This was no use to us as we had a return boat ticket for earlier than that. We were very disappointed that there was no information about this anywhere either before we got the boat or at the gate. It seems very unfair to get you all the way out there and then find out that you can't get in because they are full with groups.We spent some time wandering the grounds which are stunning but as it was quite cool we decided to go back to the city. There should be better information available as this is one of the main tourist attractions!

Peterhof Garden Tour. While we did not visit the palace interior on this tour, the tour of the gardens was magnificent and well worth visiting. We're so thankful we toured this amazing and beautiful garden!

Peterhof Palace and gardens. Well we expected the Place would be impressive and it was, but the gardens are an absolute delight. We were lucky to have a beautiful sunny day and we could have wandered around the gardens for hours, watch out for the tricky fountain!

Spectacular fountains. Had visited before Peterhof before. This trip was to Catherine's palace and Peterhof Gardens. My grandson was with me, so I wanted to be sure he saw the spectacualr fountains. He was impressed as I was the first time I visited. The only drawback was the drizzle of rain during our visit. Our guide did a great job of making sure we saw not only the fountains leading to the palace but the gardens and other lesser fountains.

Seven DON'Ts in Peterhof. Don't:1) Don't Go when it is rainy and wet2) Don't Go in low season when the fountain is not on.3) Don't visit just the upper garden, OK, it is free, but the attraction is in the Lower Garden,even you have to pay 500 R to enter, but the fountain views are worth it.4) Don't Go by hydrofoils, it expensive at 1100 R return, use the metro and bus, cost you less than 200 R return.5) Don't Spent your money and time to visit the Grand Palace, you will see better displays in the Hermitage of the Winter Palace. 6) Don't eat the food in the cafeteria, it is expensive and bland.7) Don't forget your student card if you are a student, it will save you lots of money.

Beautiful Fountains. The gardens and fountains are beautiful. All naturally water fed (no pumps) Great spot to bring a picnic. Can access via Hydrofoil from the back of palace square (along the backside of the hermitage along the Neva River)
Incredible.... wow Peterhof palce was stunning the opening ceremony all the spectacular fountains and wonderful gardens... Definitely dont miss when visiting St. Petersburg...

Glorious, majestic, amazing. Wow. Just wow. We took the local, surburban train from (name of train station in St PEtersburg - take the subway to xx and it's XX rubles for a return ticket. Trains go abut once an hour and there is a very helpful machine at the train station that not only allow you to buy tickets (cash and card, although we used cash) and to check out the timetables on the machine. Once you arrive at the Peterhof station, there is also a printed timetable, so you can time your arrival back at the station.The hydrofoil from SPB to Peterhof wasn't running during May when we took the trip, so we saved ourselves the more than 1000 ruble fee and took in a little of the countryside too. The surburban train was full, and its not the most comfortable, but it's cheap and mostly Russian visitors who were on it. Once you arrive at the station, its about a 40 minute saunter through the woods to the main entrance to Peterhof. I always raise my eyebrows when people type "just follow the crowds", but its true. Come out of the station, cross the road, and head off to the left through the woods, its a wide open path, and even at the end, when you head to the right and onto the main road for a further 10 minutes or so its obvious which way to head (having a general sense or google maps is also helpful). If you don't want a wander then there are buses and taxis waiting at the station to drop you at the main entrance.It's worth going to the main entrance, so that you get the impact of the front of the palace and the fountains and gardens as you walk down towards the ticket booths. We opted for the entrance to the grounds ticket. It was the first day after the fountains had opened for 2014, and it was a glorious day, so it was pretty busy. Signs in English are limited, but the woman in the information booth was able to tell us that we could only buy a combined ticket to include the palace at the automated booth, if we just wanted entrance we had to queue like everyone else. A XX rubles its quite a hefty cost to just wander around, but the lower gardens are beautiful.There were no maps that we could see to take away, although touts outside were selling them, so we took a photo of the map board by the ticket booths and navigated using that. After picnicing on the beach, we toured the fountains. It's easy to walk around and to navigate, and there's a big variety in plantings, in fountains and in the gardens themselves. Its very easy to lose the day here. A variety of cafes dot the grounds and there's even a fishing pond where you can hook a trout? or other fish - but the pond is so full that you literally just have to drop the hook in the water and you've caught something.Make sure to take time to look through the photo boards of the reconstruction that had to take place after WWII and you'll get a sense for how marvelous the place is.

Disney-esque. Peterhof Palace is gorgeous and definitely the must see attraction in St Petersburg.The garden is spectacular with each turn providing something new to behold ; good to see children run around trying to avoid getting splashed with water and people of all ages just snapping pictures everywhere they turn.The Grand Palace requires some patience as the lines are long but well worth the wait.Tips:- Food is available once you enter Peterhof and is actually cheaper than the food counters outside the entrance. Definitely eat inside since you can roam the Garden for a nice spot to sit and watch the view.- If the ticket line to the Palace is short, perhaps go to the Palace first and then venture to the garden afterwards.- You can either take the hydrofoil to Peterhof or take one of many tour bus from St Petersburg to Peterhof. Price wise, its not much of a difference and even though we took the tour bus, we believe we made the wrong move since you are then under tour bus timeframe (departs at 10:30, returns around 5:30) whereas with the hydrofoil, you dictate the time you want to spend.- There is a separate ticket charge to the Grand Cascade and Samson Fountain, definitely try and get tickets since you will be able to get better pictures as you are right in the action rather than taking it from the stairs on either side of the cascade/fountain.

Gold. Absolutely breathtaking. Again crowded but so much space to spread out on the grounds. The fountains at the front of the palace were spectacular and we were there when they started up. Quite an engineering feat. Highly recommend.
just amazing.. do it.. never mind the expensive boats.. take the local train for a real experience.. 20 min walk to Palace. Great celler restaurant in the old station.

Worthwhile on a trip to St. Petersburg. A bit of a trip outside of St. Petersburg but well worth it. Despite the dour faced guards the place was well situated and worth a visit. We have been to Versaille and know that this was meant to copy but it was a good visit and good place to see. Don't stay in St. Petersburg.

Gorgeous, but crowded! . We visited Peterhof with a tour group (Baltic Tours) and thoroughly enjoyed it! The grounds are stunning and the palace itself is carefully preserved and artfully restored. The biggest drawback was the amount of people crammed together both inside and out. We had to wait in line for over an hour just to get inside, and then we were herded along like cattle through the rooms at breakneck speed. Our guide kept up a fascinating commentary, but palace workers kept pushing her along to make room for more groups... I would have loved to spend more time in each room, but the amount of tourists there made a leisurely pace impossible. That said, if you like palaces and don't mind crowds, Peterhof is a fantastic stop on your itinerary.
On DenRus tour. Beautiful gardens. A must see. We did not go inside the home though. Not if you can. It was overcast and rainy, but it was still a great tour.

Amazing gardens. We took the hydrofoil from St Petersburg and so arrived from the Lower Gardens. The complex is a Russian Versailles, but whereas the fountains at Versailles are all classical, the ones at Peterhof come in all sorts of styles, meaning that you need to allow time to walk around the gardens. The inside of the palace is beautifully restored and the queue for tickets was reasonably short. Be aware that if you leave the Lower Gardens in order to see the Upper Gardens (no ticket required) on the other side of the Palace, you won't be able to get back into the Lower Gardens without buying a new ticket unless you show your hydrofoil tickets (which show that you need to re-enter the Lower Gardens to get back to the quay).

Peterhof Palace. I highly recommend touring Peterhof Palace if you visit St. Petersburg Russia. It is beautiful. The gardens are great and the fountains are extraordinary. They all work on gravity, no pumps. The palace interior is magnificent.

Amazing fountains and gardens. Did not go inside, just did the gardens which are huge! Lots of fountains, sculptures, and flowers. Be careful by the "trick fountains" which go off and water the guests. Lots of walking and limited bathroom facilities....they are there but closer to the entrance. With the palace in the background, these exquisite gardens are a must see. You find yourself looking everywhere to gather it all in!

Lovely. The Russian version of Versailles - lovely gardens and superb fountains and it seemed a venue favoured by the just married We saw quite a few newly weds going there for the post wedding ceremony photos.

100 Fountains. The Perterhof Palace was badly destroyed during World War II and is now only partly restored and may take another 20 years to complete! However, the restoration is magnificent with much gold stucco work and magnificent inlaid wooden floors which our guide did not comment on.The garden areas are huge with 100 fountains with statues all covered in gold just at the back of the palace and when the sun shines they are just wonderful. Other fountains in the gardens are in many cases unusual.
What a View!!!. Great gardens and waterfalls.....all unique. A lot of walking so be prepared...definitely not for the disabled unless in a wheelchair. The grounds were fantastic.

Beautiful!. I went while I was living in Russia and it rates as probably the best attraction I visited while I was there. We had amazing weather and it was just gorgeous. We took the hydrofoil from nearby the Hermitage to Peterhof which was fast and convenient. The fountains are beautiful and just hit you as you arrive - really breathtaking. The palace and surrounding buildings are well worth a visit too, even if you are made to wear silly looking covers on your shoes in the chapel, for instance. We had Russian student cards which let us in to the buildings for free - a price was advertised so I'm not sure why, possibly something along the lines of the Russian/foreigner prices that are in most places but we weren't going to question it however there are student prices available for foreign students so long as you have you ID with you. Totally worth going, even if you just visit the gardens. Best seen when the weather is nice but a great trip regardless.

Fantastic Peterhof. Absolutely wonderful visit. Masses of fountains and monuments covered in gold. A Must see in St petersburg. We took the Hydrofoil from the city which gave us a pleasant break before we walked around the beautiful gardens.

Entertaining. Of course, it was raining while we were here, but nonetheless, it was a great visit. We only visited the gardens, which are beautiful, dotted with lovely fountains and cascades and examples of Peter the Great's quirky sense of humour, like the benches that release a huge spray of water if you sit on them! Well worth a visit and spending time there.

Great Site - 11am Fountains are a Must See. We arrived at Peterhof around 9:30am which gave us a little more than an hour to tour the inside of the Palace. While the inside of the Palace included a lot of very interesting history and was very luxurious, the outside tour of the fountains was even better. If you go to St. Petersburg you definitely need to take the time to travel to Peterhof, and if you go to Peterhof you need to arrive before 11am so that you can be there when the fountains come on...it is truly breath taking and a must see!

Splendid Gardens, the Great Outdoors. What a wonderful experience walking around these palace gardens next to the bay. Whilst there are a lot of tourists it is nice to visit one where you have room to move and feel connected to nature. You will take a lot of pictures! Some amazing fountains. We also went into the palace which was full of grandeur. You can see that grandeur at the Hermitage and Catherine's Palace so you mainly would come here for the gardens. If you are short on time I would come here over Catherine's Palace, though the amber room there is breathtaking.

it's a must - beautiful parks and gorgeous fountains. It's beautiful and worth going to (I'd say everytime you have a chance). Try taking the boat to Peterhof (called Meteor), one of the docks is right opposite the Winter Palace, one way adult ticket is 700 rub, as of June 2014 (but there are discounts, for students for instance, even if you are a foreigner, just have your ID with you). The boat trip takes 30 min, and then you get to the ticket booths at the park entrance and can buy the entrance ticket.The Palace appeared to be hard to get into (again as of June 2014), when we arrived there already was a line and the anoouncement said they will sell only 200 tickets that day. So, if you want to go inside - book a tour, or come there early (the first boat is at 10 am).There are not so many places to eat - so I'd say bring your own food (many people do so), find a nice spot on the beach and have a picnic with a bay view.Oh, very important - the restrooms :). The ones close to the chessboard fountain were very crowded (ladies section, men's was surprisingly empty), we stood in line for 10-15 min. SO, check the map beforehand and choose the ones which are a bit farther from the crowded areas.On the way back we went to the Upper Park (which is free of charge) and took a shuttle bus to the closest subway station. The bus stop is on your right, on the opposite sid eof the road when you walk out of the Upper Park. the cost is something around 50 rub. But for non-Russian speaking visitors this can be challenging :). Otherwise, you can return back down to the dock and take the same boat back to the city (the latest leaves at 6pm if I'm not mistaken).

Get there for 11am to see fountains being switched on. Absolutely amazing sight to see and hear the fountains coming alive - felt very special. They switch on at 11 so don't miss it. Get there early to avoid the crowds. It was worth paying for an organised tour so we were able to miss the queues and also fully appreciate the wonderful ornate rooms in this fantastic palace. The guides were able to take you through room by room without getting caught up with other groups. Hydrofoil ride back to city was something different. Lovely to be able to wander around the magnificent grounds as well as the palace. My favourite attraction in st Petersburg. You will need to hand in any large bags and long coats. Cloak room can become congested.
Beautiful fountains.. Definitely must visit place. Go by water transport, it's a nice trip. Fabulous place you can walk all day long. Architecture, fountains that you'll be amazed with!

Stunning grounds. We arrived by mini-bus as it was much cheaper (and warmer) than the boatsWe really loved wandering around the upper and lower gardens.. the grand cascade is an absolute wonder, it is so gorgeous to look at. The location on the water is very impressive.

Must be visited . I spent there Arround half day , but it really deserve you should have and English guide better for you and it is available in the street of novobrosky there better if you don't have English guide try to pay for the English guide audio it is really helpful , you will see a very nice palace and a very nice garden with the most beautiful golden fountain

Amazing. I had never seen anyplace as pretty as Peterhof. The gardens and fountains and gold were over the top. We had a great guide, Olga Denisova, who new exactly where to take us within the grounds. Would love to return someday.

Mind blowing Gardens and Fountains. This place is un-doubtfully the best of all landscapes.the golden statues with fountains are the centre of attraction here.it is a themed central fountain which shows the brave Samson is fighting the lion.the palace is beautiful with very good maintenance.one entire day will not be sufficient to admire the beauty of multiple gardens and fountains located all around the park.The magical fountain adds thrilling experience and fun.when someone cross the area,suddenly from nowhere this fountain gets switched on pouring waters on the person.It was real fun for us.one must be in good physical health to walk around the park.For elders and disabled there are alternate arrangements.clicking photos almost every feet is a usual sight here,which shows how beautiful this place is.One must visit this place for a lifetime remembrance.

Beautiful side trip. Very beautiful in a sunny day. In the premises of the gardens there are many attractions and you have to pay for each one. Forget it, because only the main palace deserves the money. The set of fountains is impressive and the interior is also beautiful, Pictures inside are forbbiden what is really bad. The gardens are very good for a stroll. Try to arrive as early as possible if you plan enter the palace, because the lines are very long.

Peterhof Russia. Stunning !!! The gardens with the gold fountains are outstanding.The palace is spectacular, rooms are gold and marble. There are so many beautiful paintings. The furniture that they have been able to keep in good order. For sure a must see.

Fountains and gardens from another time. We didn't even make it into the palace. We spent the day wandering around the gardens, admiring all the different fountains and the beauty of the gardens. Impeccably maintained and diverse, it's almost impossible to describe how wonderful the gardens are to visit. The fountains are amazing - from the grandeur of the Grand Cascade to the amusing trick fountains, I kept asking myself how did they do this?

Amazingly beautiful. What an incredible experience. I was lucky enough to get on a tour to Peterhof with just one other so was quite a personal experience. The gardens are spectacular and the gold statues just blow your mind. When I arrived at the fountains it was amazing, and such a spectacle. Walking through the palace I decided to buy the book as I didn't think my photos would do it justice. You need to pay to take photos and in hindsight I wish I did now, but hey, thems to the breaks. if you are in St Petersburg, you have to visit Peterhof or you will regret missing this wonderful experience

Beautiful fountains. The tour I was in only covered just the outside of Peterhof so I don't have any reviews regarding the rooms themselves. The building looks beautiful from the outside but my favourite was the fountains. It reminded me a bit of Versailles palace grounds. The rest of the gardens itself was only ok.

Garden only. We visited the garden at Peterhof on a Monday when the Palace was closed. From the boat station on the river in St.Petersburg we caught a Hydrofoil, which was a good quick way to get to there. It rained that day but we were prepared and there was no crowd. The garden and fountains are truly stunning. The beautifully landscaped paths lead to magnificent sculptures, views and fountains to be enjoyed. There is a small forest for summer shade and a nice seafront promenade. We stayed over 3 hours but were rushed. If we hadn't already booked a return ticket we could have stayed longer. If you go in better weather you probably need most of the day. Had the Palace been open we would have spent the entire day there. On the outside of the Palace entrance gate there are food & drink vendors and restaurants but only a small soft drink cart in the gardens.

Amazing gardins. We did not have time to go inside the palace. However just going to see the grounds and the fountains were incredible. The grounds were massive. The fountains were ornate and elaborate and all powered by gravity. There are even trick fountains that Peter put in for a good laugh. If you have the time go and walk around. We were there in the rain and it was still incredible.
Extensively decorated rooms. As would be expected of a Palace the internal rooms contained beautiful period furniture and well decorated rooms, many with gold trimming. Well worth a visit.
Fantastic. The numerous fountains in these gardens and the opulence is amazing. One of the highlights of my visit.
AWESOME. It was Spectacular. Gorgeous Fountains and Statues everywhere you looked. Someday we will go back and spend the whole day there exploring.

Beautiful palace and gardens, but very difficult to get information in english. Beautiful palace and gardens, it is a wonderful day off St Petersburg. The trip by boat from the city also has beautiful views.All the information is in cyrillic and most of the guards/employees do not speak english; tickets must be acquired separately (in differente places with differente queues) to the park, the museum, the palace, the church, etc. Be prepared to be persistent and creative to manage to get admitted in the places you want to visit.

Two Day Highlights of St. Petersburg. Peterhof Gardens are beautiful and time should be spent walking around the grounds also. You can reach Peterhof by hydrofoil but the pier was being repaired when we were there so we travelled there by bus - a chance to see the countryside.

Amazing Gardens!!. We took a tour of just the Gardens with SPB Tours. What an amazing experience! Beautifully laid out garden, secret fountains, amazing statues....!! It is definitely opulent with no cost spared. Thanks to Peterhof, we have a beautiful attraction to enjoy even today.

Beautiful place to visit. We hadn't visited a Palace last time we were in St Petersburg but thought we should do so this time. We had asked someone else which to go to and they suggested Peterhof because of the fountains. It was a stunning, opulent palace, with extensive gardens & apparently, different floral displays at different times of the year...think we enjoyed the gardens even more than the Palace. It was lovely walking around and as it was sunny & 31 degrees during our visit, it was great having a lot of dappled shade to wander around in! It is a good idea to book a trip in the morning as this is when the fountains are switched on, which is spectacular. For people with mobility issues, it is worth noting that there is a longish flight of steps to each side of the fountains for access down to the gardens and back up - one lady we were with struggled up the stairs at the end; not sure if there were ramps elsewhere but it would be worth asking in advance with your tour guides. However it still wouldn't greatly spoil your trip..some other ladies asked the guide what time they could meet back up later and they did a lesser walk around without having to do the steps. Just check what your options are in advance so you are aware. Plenty of toilet facilities around too which is always good!

Fantastic not seen gardens like this. We only went around the gardens and did not go into the house. The gardens alone are fantastic with all different water features with plenty to see you could spend all day here. Take a picnic and if possible go on a fine day.

A Must in St Petersburg. This palace of Peter the Great was incredible to see. Fountains, fountains and more fountains, over 100 I believe...One can even see the Baltic Sea from the palace. Many vendors selling nice souvenirs. The palace inside is lovely but small but do not go on a rainy day as the grounds are what one must see.

Stunning! Left me speechless. The most amazing thing here is not the palace but the grounds. The fountains are amazing, especially the main one at the back of the palace. Walking the grounds is one "awe" after another. The inside is also worth a visit, but the grounds - unbelievable.
A must. Spectacular. Worth the detour.Although it was damage during the Second World War it has been very well renovated.

Impressive grounds & interior. Compared to Catherine Palace at night (which we recommend) the grounds at Peterhof were certainly in another league. If you visit in the morning beware, the fountains did not start flowing until around the 1000--1100 time frame. We also visited the refreshment tent right outside the gate and they only take Rubles compared to other venues where we could use Euros. It got really crowded at the entrance and the lines to pickup your coats from the cloak room merged with the entrance queue. Leave your coat on your bus if the weather permits. Very large gift shop with competitive prices. Would have loved to see the palace light up at night.

Outstanding Gardens leave Versailles for Dead. Quite a claim I know but the gardens here are designed using the natural geography, the coast and the water fountains using natural gravity.The place is spectacular and worth a whole day tour. Sadly our half day was barely enough time to walk the gardens which comprise 2,000 acres
Loved Peterhof. A lovely place to visit. Beautiful palace and the rooms inside are amazing. Great for a quick visit or for spending a whole day. Gardens and fountains make for beautiful photos.

Gardens fit for a Tsar. My tour of this site only covered the impressive gardens and elaborate fountains. This site was used to greet visitors arriving by water. The fountains include a number of gold leafed figuresfrom mythology. Beautiful massive beds of tulips, trees, gardenswith fountains. Our guide said it was used only in the late springto early autumn months while the fountains were thawed. The gardens and fountains are amazing--truly fit for a Tsar or a Tsarina!
Big garden with flowers. Huge garden with blooming colorful flowers, many street foods, souvenir sellers also toilet on the road site.

Stunning. Lovely views over the Gulf of Finland. Impressive fountains. Take a guide book as there is very little in English and you tend to get shunted on to make way for the Russian tours inside the Grand Palace and Mon Plaisir. Mon Plaisir is a must and the staff seem much nicer in there. Frustrating that everything is paid for separately as it is quite pricey but choose well and it is worth it.

A Palace and a Palace Garden, nice but expensive. The place is nice overall, but you'll need to get there by boat which can be pricey (which is about 1300 RUB round trip) or try your way by public transport.Then its 500 RUB to enter the gardens, and some more for entering the Palace and other areas.Unless you have lots of time and don't mind spending the money, I would recommend exploring the cathedrals in St Petersburg, or go to Peter and Paul Fortress, or spend the money on some yummy Russian food or drinks
Wow!. Another extremely interesting venue. Again, our Guide gave us a thorough introduction to the Palace and Garden.

Worth a visit but the crowds spoilt this place. The hovercraft is fun to take to Peterhof, the problem was huge amounts of groups, allowed to enter the palace, so ended up queuing through the apartments which spoilt it. It worked out very expensive as there's a separate entrance fee for everything - gardens, palace, and all the other buildings within the grounds.

A monument not only to the Peter the Great but to the restoration skills of the Russians. Peter the Great built this palace as a place of retreat and play. While much enlarged by his successors, its heart is still very much his monument. The Gardens are world famous for the fountains, especially the trick ones that offer a surprise dousing to the unwary, or really, the aware but adventuresome visitor. The Nazis devastated the grounds and buildings. The Soviets, whatever their very real faults, devoted years of meticulous work to restoring the building to its original splendor. It is a must see for any visitor to the St. Petersburg area. Please take the time to study the photos of the extensive damage done by the Nazis and compare that with the glory of the restoration.

A must see during your st petersburg visit. Stunning groomed gardens and grounds. Take a hydrofoil and enjoy the trip. Wear comfortable walking shoes. Your admission ticket pays for the lower grounds area which is vast with many ponds, fountains, walking paths. The palace has a separate entry fee. There are many souvenir and food stands. You can pay 800 rubles for a golf cart tour. Numerous picturesque views with excellent photo opportunities. Go in the morning and make it a day trip. This would be far less enjoyable if the weather was cold or rainy, as so much of this is outdoors. Kid friendly, lots of strollers.
Astonishing. I had only a 3 hours time but strolling trough the gardens was a wonderful experience. One of the best I saw around the world. MUST SEE

Gradens of Peterhof. Peter the Great was really an exceptional man, the fountains at Peterhof, especially teh Cascade are breathtaking, and amazingly no pumps are used, incredible, want to go bakc again

Beautiful restoration of Peterhof palace. Recently went on a tour of Peterhof in St Petersburg, Russia. Beautiful restoration and lovely gardens. The fountains are spectacular. Well done and immaculate. Be advised you are not allowed to take any photos inside the palace. Tour crowds can be tedious but take it in stride and enjoy the palace.

Unclear and Poor service, need to buck up.. Actually Peterhof is a fabulous place to be and worth to take a half day trip definitely, but the service is terrible, when I arrived at it bu boat, I saw 5 ticket counters, each of them got a long q line, but aft 10min I followed one of them, I was told no ticket available in this counter, but there is no any sign on it to declare it. And no free map available either. And........ there are tons of small museums/exhibitions/overpriced shutter service inside, and it likely costs you thousands of rubs to finish them, don't forget to prepare you tens of rubs for toilet cost...... I think local govt should do sth to improve the service due to it doesn't match the reputation of Peterhof itself.

NOT TO BE MISSED. Go early by hydrofoil. There is nothing to see when the hydrofoil hits the open but it will get you in time for the water show. The beginning is with classic music. The statues covered with gold leaf are very impressing. Hire a golf cart if you want to see the whole garden. It is 1000 acres. Wear comfortable shoes.
this is a must have seen place. very very nice. This is a must have seen place. The palace is nice and has many to see and the garden is marvellous.

Northern Versaille. It is the other must-visit in St. Petersburg. Known as Peter the Great's "Russian Versaille" as it was originally drafted by Peter and modelled on Louis XIV Versaille with the intension to outshine the rival. The majestic grand palace, gardens and fountains including the spectacular Grand Cascade are truly the jewels of St. Petersburg's suburban estates.We left Peterhof via hydrofoil (included in the tour package), which was another pleasant experience.

Thank you, Peter the Great, for Peterhof!. Peterhof consists of a main palace, twenty or so smaller palaces and pavilions. But the main attractions are the incredible gardens, park and fountains. There are over 174 unique fountains and statues throughout these beautiful complex.

Fabulous Fountains. The gardens and fountains of this palace are not to be missed. We unfortunately went on a rainy day but were still impressed with the design and uniqueness of the fountains and grounds. Bring a camera as the photo ops are numerous. One word of warning, the tour crowds can be huge and at times frustrating. Try to find a bit of an isolated spot higher up on the palace hill and enjoy the views.

A must see if you're in St Petersburg. We took the hydrofoil to Peterhof. Book the return trip so you pay a slightly reduced fare of 1100 rubles. On a good day, the outbound trips fill up fast so try and plan in advance. The hydrofoil starts at 10am so book your ticket at the ticket office according to when you want to leave. You need about three hours for the gardens alone. Book the time of your return trip up front as seats in the hydrofoil are limited. You will need to pay to enter the gardens as well. However, there is no English signage at the ticket office, and none of the cashiers spoke English. We ended up paying 500 rubles to enter but had no idea whether this included the Palace as well as the gardens. We only wanted to see the gardens so we may have been overcharged, but we had no way of knowing. We packed a picnic and found a shady spot in the gardens to have our lunch. It was a great way to stop and relax and enjoy the calmness. A fun thing to do is head towards the Trick Fountains. There is a sign telling you when the next one starts. If you're in for a bit of a cool-down on a hot day, stand on the tree-lined avenue and wait for the fountains to spray you. Be warned though, you will be soaked through! We ended off our visit by walking along the edge of the beach. It is obviously a popular spot for wedding photos - we spotted three brides in 30 minutes having their photo shoots done there! Definitely worth seeing Peterhof for the opulence and fountains.

Beautiful gardens and palace. After viewing Catherine palace this is a let down but unique in its own way. A quick tour thru and some amazing pictures of how it looked after WW 2. The restoration work that has been done is amazing to see. The statues still are dirty from being buried so the Nazis wouldn't get them. Unlike Catherine palace, most items are original as we're saved from the war and well hidden. Much history here.

Watch the added extras. A beautiful place. Great gardens. Easy trip on ferry. Spectacular surrounds. However everything is an additional cost. The ferry is the first then another charge to enter the gardens then another for the palace. Extra 500 rub if you want audio in English. Soon adds up.

Amazing. The fountains, the gardens, the palace. All that glitters and pulses with a majesty from a by gone era. We went on a small group tour from St. Petersburg and thoroughly enjoyed our day. You can also travel there by hydrofoil.

Must visit in St Petersburg . Really easy to get to from St Petersburg. Just jump on a hydrofoil right in front of the Winter Palace, they leave every 20/30 mins and only take 30 mins. Your admission ticket just lets you into the gardens so if you want to visit Grand Palace etc you have to purchase additional tickets. You could easily spend a whole day here. There is lots to see and do. The gardens are beautiful as are the fountains as you walk up to the palace. I would recommend also doing a your of the Grand Palace.

a wonderful place. This is a wonderful place. The park is really huge and very beautiful in good weather. There are fountains everywhere. I recommend you to go here in summer. Unfortunately, the palace was closed when we came, but we could visit some other buildings and the underground and see the construcrion of the fountain sistem.

Oh My Goodness. We did not visit the interior of the palace but we spent almost 2 hours at the gardens. The design, layout, fountains, statues and grounds are incredible. Well worth the time and expense.

Fantastic place. Such a beautiful and a fantastic palace it's like it was the first water park so many fountains and water traps tin the enormous gardens the house er palace is out of this world well worth a visit 10 out of 10

Beautifull despite the rain.. A national treasure. So immense and impressive. Lovely gardens with fountains . Check out the golden corridor and the amber room. Lovely Delft tile fireplaces brings you back to an area ofZars and Zarinas.

Must See When in St. Petersburg. We toured the palace and gardens on a beautiful spring day. It was the first day that all the fountains were on. The palace is beautiful but the fountains and gardens are the stars of this attraction.

Palace Par Excellence. Well, you haven't truly immersed yourself in St. Petersburg unless you've toured Peterhof. The glory of palace itself is exceeded only by the fabulous grounds with their endlessly beautiful and varied fountains. The palace tour guides lead you through grand rooms of marvelous furniture and epic paintings equal to anything Versailles has to offer. Definitely a must-see and allow at least 3 hours for the experience. Better yet, take a lunch and spend the day.

Gardens spectacular. We loved seeing the Peterhof gardens with all the fountains. We had to get to Peterhof on our own because the hydrofoil option wasn't working to get there. Our hotel hired a taxi for us with a driver that the reception used frequently. The hotel then gave us instructions for catching the metro back to St. Petersburg. It was surprisingly easy and we enjoyed the transportation both ways.

Beautiful gardens. tour did not take us inside, but the grounds and gardens are not to be missed. Peter copied a lot of what he saw in other european countries. There is a lot of walking...but beautiful sites worth the walk.

Beautiful Gardens. The gardens were amazing. The fountains were beautiful. We had a chilly, overcast day but still found it enjoyable walking through the beautiful garden area. Definitely something you want to go see while in St. Petersburg.
Must See. This was a beautiful place for a stroll through the gardens and fountains. We took our whole family from age 4 through 50. Beautiful day and beautiful setting.

Breathtaking. We only toured the gardens and were overwhelmed with the lushness and ingenuity of the water features. This park is hugh and on a wonderful sunny day, which we had, it is glorious to walk the paths.

A must see . Peterhof Palace and gardens is a must see sight . Absolutely stunning . Wonderful experience . The gardens are truly magnificent . The history lesson alone is worth the trip from St Petersburg

MAGNIFICENT GARDENS & FOUNTAINS. Peterhof only opens in May so we missed it on our last visit three years ago in April -it is a must see if you are in St. Petersburg in the summer time.Arrived just in time for the main fountain display -it was a perfect blue sunny skied day and the water shooting up against the golden fountains was a great sight & a great photo opportunity.Beautiful gardens which have a number of different fountains,including the trick fountains which were being enjoyed by the kids. Tour include the Bath house which was interesting but long queues to get in -not able to visit the Palace as part of out tour, that will be for another time,but it looked fantastic from the outside. Could have spent a lot more time at Peterhof but when you are with a tour you are on a timer. Had we gone independently we would have stayed the whole day as the whole thing is just so beautiful.
Wonderful waterfalls!. The gardens are immaculately kept and we thoroughly enjoyed spending half a day admiring the numerous quirky waterfalls.A 'must see' on your list!
Fantastic Gardens. Get there by 11:00 am to see the the water show and then take times to see all the fountains and gardens

Beautiful gardens. We did not go on an organised tour but visited it independently. We travelled there by metro and bus as the hydrofoil jetty is not completed yet - but that would be the best way to go. You have to buy tickets for the lower gardens before going inside to find a huge queue to enter the Palace. We didn't manage to get in, but had a wonderful time walking round all the fountains in the sunshine.Even if you buy tickets you still have to queue as you need to go round the Palace in a tour and the English tour was full.

Palace and the fountains to be seen !. Also do not miss the bath and sauna build by the Tsar for his daughter who got asthma - very interesting water / shower system, to be seen. Also the Palace with it's great collection of art and artifact. A must seen
Fantastic. We were at the palace and gardens in May.It was a heatwave and it all looked beautiful in the sunshine.The fountains danced in the sunlight and the palace was fabulous.

The gardens and water features were lovely. We got there early (9:30) so had the garden to ourselves. But the crowds I liked the coffee and pancakes in the expensive Cafe. It was nice to sit away from the crowds and in the shade.
Amazing with splendid gardens. This Palace has a wow factor with beautifully manicured gardens and the Tulips in Bloom made this palace picture perfect

resting place of a history. the graves of the rulers, in this cathedral, are beautiful to see, and follow around, with--again--spectacular decorations wherever you look....in spite of 1917 the history lives in a very real fashion....
This historic palace is worth a visit.. The place is well-worth a visit but the huge gardens require lots of walking. As for public toilets, such facilities are few and far between...

very orderly and worth seeing. if you go with tour company, you don't have to fall in line. the place is very orderly manner in seeing the rooms. there's always an attendant before you enter each room. they provide you with purple shoe covers to maintain the cleanliness of the palace. the gardens are well-kept.

The Gardens are Stunning. The gardens at Peterhof are absolutely stunning. The fountains are incredible. The history of the palace is interesting and they did a fabulous restoration. It is great to walk along the Gulf of Finland and get some fresh sea breeze.

YOU HAVEN'T BEEN TO ST. PETERSBURG UNLESS YOU SEE THIS EXTRAVAGANCE. OK this is the Russian Palace of Versailles. This was Peter the Great's Summer Palace.We took a fast hydrofoil boat to Peterhof.The humongous Gardens have some of the most wonderful fountains which run on only pumps and centrifugal force. Seeing the fountains turn on in front of the Palace is just so special to watch.If you're in St. Petersburg you will enjoy seeing this gem.

Pictures do not do it justice. We took the high speed catamaran to get there was was wonderful. The grounds are truly amazing. It's hard to,imagine that much opulence in one place. A must if in St. Petersburg.

Fountains!!. I cannot begin to describe this place, supposedly it would take you a week to walk around the entire gardens. The fountains have no hydraulics on gravity,over 100 of them and they are elaborate, as well as tricky, be prepared for the squeals of delight from the kids as they wait for the trick fountain to soak them!

Great combination of nature and culture. There's no attraction compared to the moment of the daily opening of the fountains (11:00 AM) and playing the music alltogether. An astonishing experience !Beautiful gardens, fountains, bay view and various music played around the gardens.Highly recommended to have a tour guide with you.
Amazing beauty inside and outside. There is gold everywhere inside and outside. Each room is different and gorgeous. Be sure you have a guide take you through so you can learn about what is there.

Has to be seen to be believed. Not sure we would have got i past the crowds without a guide. Once in the opulence is hard to take in.
Spare time for the lovely gardens complete with Red Squirrels and fountains

Contrasting Views: Hot and Cold. Ours was a group trip to the Peterof Palace and Garden in St. Petersburg, Russia. This is a charming location with stunning gardens and grounds that are equaled in few other places. The grounds are immaculately groomed and maintained as are the buildings both inside and out. There's more gold than a person can imagine. As apart of a trip through the Baltic Capitals region, this site was clearly the most spectacular. The downside was the trip through the interior of the palace itself. The inside sites are also superb. The conditions walking through the beautifully appointed rooms were deplorable with 250 or more people in each room at the same time with as many as 4 tour guides talking in that room at the same time. It was surely just as unpleasant as being a bovine at the livestock auction. The tour guides were partially responsible but the associates of the attraction were pushing groups forward about 5 speeds faster than comfortable. Don't miss the exterior and gardens. They are free but the inside tour is somewhat expensive and disappointing. Interior picture taking is not allowed

Extravaganza on Bay of Finland. Beautiful gardens and golden spites; appears like Versailles North, although the gardens in France appeared nicer, the location,and the fountains, at Peterhof appeared more royal, in my opinion.Well worth the visit

Absolutely divinely beautiful. Peterhof is a must see place if you are visiting St. Petersburg. We have been many times in all seasons (we live here). The most recent was a couple of weeks ago when the fountains were turned on. There were huge crowds around the fountain areas but once you get slightly away from the central area it's very peaceful. The views toward the gulf of Finland are beautiful. In winter it is fantastic because there is no-one else around. It's as if you own the place yourself. But obviously no fountains in winter. Go there. Be amazed. Pretend it's your garden for a few hours. You'll love it.

Go for the Palace. The distance from the city (about an hour away by taxi or boat, or 1.5 hours by train/bus) and unclear pricing results in a 1-star reduction. We arrived near a fountain and the upper gardens which appear open to the public. To gain entrance to the lower gardens, it costs 500 RUP for foreigners (300 if you're Russian, I think). Then, to see the Palace, it was an additional 550 per person. The Palace is worth the price though. Very impressive upkeep. We didn't go with a tour, but there were dozens of tour groups there and you need to go through the rooms in sequence, so we just listened as the many other tour guides explained the differences in each room.Lower gardens were large, but not that special (lots of trees and fountains) and there are many museums all over the grounds, but you have to pay for each one, so we didn't go in.Overall a good visit, but the Palace was definitely the highlight, even at the expense.

Marvelous fountains. When we visited this palace, there was a ceremony for their 290e anniversary. Everything was cordonned off. Unfortunately we could not approach the fountains. We had to stay behind the barriers. But the site in unbelievable. The fountains start at 11h00. So do not get there before. The water comes from sources located 10km away. Every fountain is feed by gravity. No pumping at all. A real engineering feat. At night, water accumulates in few reservoirs. The next day, water is let go from the reservoirs and start it descend toward the fountains.The site is immense. Thousands of trees, flowers everywhere. You can walk the park for hours. But it is crowdy. Fortunately for us, our ship was opening the tourist season; so we were not sqeezed amongst thousands of people. We could easily walk the gardens and take zillions of pics.This is a must see attraction.

Peterhof garden was renovated. I remember Peterhof garden since childhood, I always liked to look like fountains were starting in May after winter. Strong jet of Samson fountain rose high above. It's recently updated garden, gilded statues shone again. There you can have a great time!

Nice to walk in gardens in a sunny day. The gardens can be quite challenging to get there by bus and train so we took the hydrofoil from the docks in the admiral district (next to the hermitage). Nice way to travel and only about an hour. The gardens themself are very beautiful and the fountains impressive, the cascades run at 11am and then summer in the evenings so check the times on website to see these. While palace is closed Mondays and the last Tuesday of each month, the gardens are still able to be toured.
Loved the fountains. This was one of my favorite stops in St. Petersburg. The fountains and gardens are breath-taking. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour of this facility.

brilliant. fantastic experiencetry to get there for 11 when they turn on the fountainshydrofoil doesnt work till june, so got ripped off by taxi getting tgere (3000 rubels) but public transport good for way back (10 rubels)gardens spectacular, can wonder round for hourscheck times for palace, as we could not get in

Beautiful Palace. The palace and grounds are stunning. Check out the waterfall gardens that decorate the backyard of the palace. Make sure to see the Peacock clock that was a gift to Catherine the Great.

A must see with private guide. We took a private guide again and car to get there. This proved to be a wise choice as she guided us to the important parts, got us through the crowds quickly to the front of the lines and was a wealth of information throughout.

The most amazing and spectacular park. This park and museum is a definite must. Absolutely breath taking. The grounds , fountains and sculptures and the way it was designed makes it a truly worth while sight to see. It is about an hours drive from the city.

Amazingly Beautiful. Second visit and it still wowwed me. The design of the gardens, the fountains, waterfalls and the palace are just staggering. Well worth the one hour journey out of the City - but watch out for pickpockets.

Beautiful palace and peaceful gardens. First went here in 1977! Returned in 2014--still spectacular and the renovations after Nazi occupation continue. The gold statues are magnificent but the gardens are a peaceful place to wander for and hour or two overlooking the Gulf of Finland
Peterhof. The place is worth visiting. It's better to be there when the sun is shining .The fountains and the sculpture glitter in the sunlight.

Beautiful. Beautiful palace and the gardens are stunning. It is a little bit out of St Petersburg on the Gulf of Finland, around an hour drive depending on traffic. The rooms in the palace were beautiful and very bright, we were wearing short jackets but were asked to leave them in cloakroom and you also will have to put plastic covers over your footwear to protect the beautiful flooring. The fountains were switched on at 11am and they are stunning, unfortunately the weather was against us and it was pouring but didn't spoil it for us. Well worth visiting.
Beautiful palace worth the visit. The gardens are very vast but overrated compared to other gardens in European palaces. The palace itself was a real treat with all the golden rooms.
Awesome Palace. An enormous palace built by Catherine 1 and extended by the Great. Rooms and decoration rivals Versailles, but doesn't quite get there. Every room has something to offer.
Beautiful fountains. Lovely gardens and the fountains are out of this world. Spectacular place full of history and has been preserved well.

Beautiful place!. Took a boat out to see this across the gulf of Finland, and wow it was worth it! The architecture was amazing, all the gardens are beautiful and is so nice , ideal for taking perfect pictures.

Out of town but worth the trip. This is an amazing palace, a little way out of St Petersburg to get to but we managed via Metro and small mini bus. Plenty to read up about this palace and too much to describe in a review but this is a must see attraction in St Petersburg. As well as the Palace itself the palace grounds are excellent to walk about in.
Fantastic Place!. We loved Peterhof both inside and out. The fountains are just fantastic and its lovely to walk down to the sea. A marvellous place to visit.

Fountains are Amazing--Spend a Day Enjoying the Park!. I've visited the Peterhof before, so this time we spent our time outside visiting the park and gardens. The fountains and the park are so beautiful. If you have some time, see the palace, but then walk around outside.

Take some minutes away from Skt Petersburg. If you want to experience some fountains and some beautiful garden in a very quit place then you MUST visit Petershof - with Metro - train and a local bus it will take you an hour to get there to a very cheep price (approx 100 RUB) - so do make the trip away from the city.. It is for sure worth it..!
Breathtaking.. The inside of the palace is large and each room is unique. The highlight of the palace is the gorgeous grounds and fountains. The views are breathtaking.
Petergoff. Of the many sites in SPB, this is a must. We went on an early spring weekday and the crowds were small. Also to be seen in the Peter and Paul Cathedral across the highway.

A mixed experience. Make sure you get here to watch the fountains being switched on. This was 11.00 when we visited in May. A not to be forgotten experience. The cascade and grounds were a wonderful experience, but we both love gardens and I have a thing about fountains! The Palace was a different experience altogether. We were there independently and found the lack of information totally confusing. There seem to be times when only Russians were allowed in and queue jumping was rife. We eventually got in, were given directions to go in a certain direction only to be sent back to get tickets! Having bought tickets we were accosted and forced to check our shoulder bags in despite the fact that we had been through that process a few minutes earlier with no problem. We were herded into groups with only a Russian language guide and not allowed to go through independently. The staff could all have got a part in a James Bond movie and had clearly had a training manual which stated: don't smile, wag your finger and be as oppositional as you can. We were glad to get out of the place.
A very interesting place. Nice parks and buildings, shows really well the way they enjoyed life. Well kept and well organized.

Wonderful gardens and fountains -- skip the palace!. The gardens are truly beautiful and the fountains are spectacular but the tour of the palace was a disappointment and not worth the cost. It's also a little disappointing that most of this is a rebuild since the Nazis destroyed a great deal on their retreat. At the end of the day we're really not seeing Peter the Great's original palace -- just a recreation of it.
Best place in St petersburg. The peterhof located outside of the St petersburg city center. The Peterhof is nice to visit if you travel to St petersburg. So don't miss.

excellent. We went on May unfortunately weather was rainy. However we enjoyed a lot..Garden very nice ; pools are incredible..Strongly recommended..
PS: I suggest, find a nice guide to understand exactly Peterhof

Gorgeous in summer. You have, let's say, three days in St. Petersburg. Which of the stately homes you'd visit? Decisions, decisions. The main attractions are Tsarskoe selo and Peterhof. Well, when it comes to visiting Peterhof, I'd definitely recommend seeing it in late spring or summer, because its main attraction lies in the park full of beautiful fountains that won't operate until May, or, sometimes in late April as they are being tested. They make for a really pleasant walk. I haven't seen the Palace itself, as you can only enter with a tour group and the number of visitors was limited. All of this I only knew by asking the lady at the entrance in Russian and I doubt whether you'd be able to get the same information in English. So if you don't go as a part of a tour group with a bus from Gostinniy dvor in Petersburg, this place does not seem very tourist-friendly.Entrance to the grounds is free and the walks are nice, you can get some refreshments and souvenirs. However, to Petersburg first-timers and visitors in autumn and winter I'd rather recommend visiting Tsarskoe selo instead.

Go when it´s sunny. You will need sunshine to see all the beauty at its best- there are many golden statues that need to be shining in the sun. Also check whether fountains are on. Do not miss the statue of Neptun- touching his left feet brings you money, touching his right feet brings you good health.

worth to see. it is wonderfull place. it is golden statues, marble statues, green park with many beautiful fountains, the main summer residence of russian imperiors (palace) etc. if you don't know how to visit it by yourself, write to me and i will tell you

Breath-taking must experience!. I spent a lovely afternoon at Peterhof with my friend Katherine in the late summer of 2011. The best way of transportation is to take the speedy hydrolift boats going on an hourly basis from St. Petersburg, but it is a reasonably painless drive by car as well, approx 1 hrs from St. Pete. However, I reccomend the boattrip. Once at Peterhof enjoy the opulence and goldcoated fountains in the vast gardens, the buildings are also spectacular and in perfect condition after many years of maticulate restauration. I reccomend to bring a picnic-basket and camp out by the banks of the gulf of Finland as the food available to buy in the various cafe's and restaurants is both of a low quality and very expensive! I hope to return to Peterhof on my next summer venture to St. Petersburg!

Absolutely stunning. This building and it's gardens was very impressive. The interior design of each room was so well preserved and stunning in it's composition. So many different types of materials from different sources were used to create such individual spaces. Unfortunately photographs are not allowed to be taken inside but there were good books available to show all the key areas. The grounds with the ornamental gardens and fountains were equally impressive. This is well worth the trip away from the city.....

Take public transport and go in Summer!. Perhaps not the easiest way to get there, but by FAR the cheapest, costing less than £5 (250 roubles) for a return journey from St. Petersburg is by metro, and then Marshrutka - minivans that are used as buses. Personally I went to Avtovo metro and then got a marshrutka right to the gates - they're easy to find as soon as you leave the station. Although the park was very beautiful, I was surprised by the price with comparison to everything else - it seemed a lot more expensive, and every museum and extra part of the palace was excluded from the price - in total it was exactly a cheap outing! I definitely think it was made wonderful by the fountains - even though it was cold and raining a little when I went, it was still worth seeing. Take a picnic - the food is very expensive! I wouldn't include it though, if I were going to the city for a shorter trip in the Winter.

Plan your visit around the fountain schedule. The fountains do not do not go on until May, so if you come to St Petersburg before then, you will not get to see the wonderful water works. We went here with a private tour guide so we were able get right in as we already had our tickets purchased in advance. If you can I highly recommend doing this. The line to get tickets was very long, as well as the line to get in. Go early!!!The Gardens are massive! You can walk around forever. There are a few "magic" rock gardens that you can walk on. The kids try and find the "magic" rock that will make water come up out of the ground. There is a man that sits behind a chair that controls the water, not the rocks the kids step on. But don't tell your kids this :)
Great place to visit.. Arrive before 11:00am to see the fountains start up. Palace inside is spectacular including the floors.

A stunning place to visit. This is such a beautiful place. We got there very cheaply through using the metro and bus. It is stunning visually but also peaceful and unhurried in atmosphere - a wonderful place to enjoy just being with family; take time to sit and look at the beauty of the gardens. We took peanut nibs and the little sparrows will feed from your hand. We enjoyed a cold glass of beer n the sunshine and meandered round for hours. Amazing. Enjoy!

Go when the Fountains are on. We went when the fountains were on and spent 6 hours walking the gardens and seeing the 20 odds different fountains. Many of the individual fountains are great by themselves but the fountain group called the Grand Staircase truly takes your breath away.We loved Saint Petersburg and this location is one of the reasons why.A hint we found is you can travel return by public transport for a bout $4

Amazing palace restored to former glory after WW2. We were the guests of a St. Petersburg family that took us out to Peterhof. The coach trip took a long time as a result of heavy traffic and diversions because the G20 meeting was being held in St Petersburg the week we visited. It was decided just to explore the gardens and waterfalls and these were really spectacular and in our opinion were better than those at the Palace of Versailles, that we had visited the previous month, We can imagine how grand the interior must have been but that may have to wait for another visit. Some of the many waterfalls can be seen from my tattached photos as well as gold inlay for most tof the statues and spires of the palaces. Also the devastation from WW2 can be seen from a display of photos - apparently the poulation of the city rallied to restore the gardens and palace to their former glory reasonably soon after the end of hostilities and continue to this day.

Quite beautiful.. We came a bit early in the season, but still quite beautiful. The fountains were just being turned on. The cost of the palace tour was a bit high, and the people were not that friendly (except the coat check lady, who was really very friendly). Fun to see!

Incredible. I've been there 4 times (whenever I'm in Petersburg) and yes it's a must see. The fountains are incredible and the palace mind blowing, well I guess it's one of the places you must have visited in your life

Stunningly beautiful palace and grounds. Plan to spend a full day.. This was our second visit, first time as a shore excursion on an ocean cruise and this time as part of a river cruise. Both visits were for a few hours, which isn’t enough time. They do rush the palace tours, but then a lot of people want to see it. Cruise ship tour groups can get in before the official opening time. Our friends had also been here before and we all wanted to explore the grounds more, so we passed on the palace tour this time and went out to the West rear grounds. We were there early in the morning, so the fountains weren’t on yet. After wandering for a while, we staked out a place on the first bridge over the canal about an hour prior to catch the start of the fountains. I took video while my friend took stills with a tripod. We all enjoyed watching the fountains come to life while the music played. Afterward, we headed toward the East side, but ran out of time before we got too far.There’s a lot to see and it can get quite crowded with all the cruise boat tourist buses (like ours), so I would recommend getting there early and making a day out of it. As usual in Europe, have some change for the toilets.

Beautiful. Stopped here on the last day of our tour adn were very impressed with the Palace and gardens. The gardens are beautiful although the fountains were not yet turned on which would have been nice to see. There is no photography allowed which is not a big deal as you can still make the most of the experience!

Gorgeous venue. Get here early so you hear the music and see the fountains as they are turned on. The grounds and the entire area, with fabulous gardens, are absolutely beautiful, and well worth a visit. This is so much more than a typical "palace." It's outside the city and takes time to get there -- but this is one place that's not to be missed.

Superb beauty, but better go in summer. Peterhof palace is a whole historical complex of builduings, gardens and fountains also known as the "Russian Versailles". It was conceived by Peter I in the beginning of the 18th century and built up in around 10 years. The Peterhof palace is especially worth visiting in summer due to functioning fountains, which boost its attractiveness and make for unforgettable impressions captured and retained in fotos... You may particularly enjoy the views to the sea from the Upper Garden!
Must see!. Must see! Lots of beautiful palaces and fountains. We often visit this place! It is a pleasure to walk there/

amazing. Tourists from St. Petersburg would probably need to travel to and from by hydrofoil - located behind Hermitage Museum. There are separate admissions to many of the individual little buildings on this enormous site. No need to do this. Main building can be seen only with guided tour, wearing disposible booties over shoes. A bit rushed, but a WOW experience, until the gold leaf everywhere causes one's eyes to glaze over. Not to despair. The grounds are wonderful. Our family of three enjoyed an entire day here, spending way more time than we thought we would. Interesting fountains, lovely trees, plantings, etc, etc, etc, in all directions. Places to eat and have ice cream. Places to sit and people watch. Fabulous: Russian mothers in stiletto heels pushing strollers on gravel walkways. I started taking photos of those 5" heels! Back to Peterhof. It is worth an entire day. Many, many 'local' tourists: Russian families out for the day. They arrive by car, not the hydrofoil. I loved this place. So did my husband and adult son. Hope we can return. Wish it was not so far from NYC.

Nice palace. I visited the place in early April, so the fountains were not in function. The great palace was quite interesting, although I think that summer palaces in other european cities are more amazing (Versailles, Potsdam, Shonbrunn). Access by public transport is really easy.

Beautiful Palace. pro's and con's going out of season - pro's no que's, no hoards of people, no rush to take in the beauty of every room in the palace.con's no waterfalls until may Well worth the visit - easily reached from st. petersburg using the metro and then the bus, you will save about £30 - £40 each

Spectacular. Of the 4 main palaces in the St. Petersburg area - the others being Catherine's Palace, Yusupov Palace, Hermitage (museum with palace interior) - Peterhof is the most scenic because of its location on the Gulf of Finland and the sloping site that leads down to the sea.The gardens with 66 fountains, 39 gold-guilded statues and 20 km of manmade canals are a "sight" to behold. If you have enjoyed Versailles, Schoenbrunn or Hampton Court among others, this park ranks right there at the top. Built in the 1700s as Russia's "Window to Europe" the grand palace was meticulously restored after the German destruction and siege of Leningrad in WWII according to Peter The Great's original plans. From May - September take the hydrofoil from the Hermitage Embankment for an unforgettable arrival.Peterhof should not have its own sight category; it is confusing to separate it from the other spectacular sight in St. Peterburg. And the photo does not do any justice to the grandeur of the palace.

Wow. It's so wonderful place! When you visit it, you feel the past centuries... You walk and walk, the pictures aroud you are better and better! So many places to make cool photos! If you come to St.Petersburg you should visit this place in summer, of the end of may! Because in this time fountains are running

Beautifully Restored Palace. The palace itself is very nice but the main reason to go are the gardens and fountains. Unfortunately, you don't get these in the winter but it is still worth the trip. You also don't get the huge crowds of people

RUSSIAN BRUTALITY AND BEAUTY IN ONE PLACE. We visited whilst the gardens were under snow and the fountains were empty and the statues were in boxes but it was still beautiful. We walked down to the end of the pier where the sea had actually frozen. Inside the building was magnificent as was the church in the palace.When you see the pictures of the Palace after being bombed and the damage done by the Germans it is amazing that this building has been restored to such high standards. Such an irony that the Russians decided to kill all their royals and then restore their Palaces for tourism?

Splendid Peterhof. The palace and parks are amazing, the palace is a splendid edifice of white and gold, whose interior is packed with beautiful rooms each displaying some delightful pieces of furniture. Photography is not allowed within the palace, but is encouraged in the grounds. As you enter the palace you are led up the main staircase, which is tremendous, into the magnificent Dance Hall and so it goes on, room after room. Peterhof Palace must one of the most beautiful buildings in the world.Outside there are wonderful gardens with hundreds of fountains and statues, but the piece de resistance is the Grand Cascade which consists of more than 60 fountains and over 250 statues. Although the palace was all but destroyed by the german army after the siege of St Petersburg, the russian authorities have faithfully reproduced the original palace.Guided tours are generally for half a day but it doesn’t seem long enough. We recommend you buy a book e.g “PETERHOF” which contains the history and a description of the palace and hundreds of photographs that you would love to have taken.
Peter is the Great!. Unbelievable, Must See to believe, wonderful fountains, gardens and a great fast ride by boat. Take your time and enjoy this wonderful place!

Zabojad Exploring Russia. A wonderful Park and Garden where we could travel with a fast boat and feel the wind and fly over the Water. I really appreciated our Tour and discovery while Travelling in Russia. A magic Sightseeing experience and a must do in Romantic company.

Delightful place. The best time to visit the place is summer time. The spectacular parkland at Peterhof is remarkable for the sheer variety of styles encompassed in its layout and features. Lower Park with Fountains:Open- Daily, 9 am to 8 pm. Last admission at 7:30 pm. Fountains operate from 11 am to 6 pm (Saturday and Sunday till 7 pm).Admission: RUB 450.00. Students and children: RUB 250.00. After 6 pm: RUB 100.00Photo and video: Photo (without tripod) is allowedAccessibility note: The garden is wheelchair accessible.
The park and the palace of the great Pier. Palace like all our family. I think that the government should allocate money to save the cultural heritage of the Russian people.
great place for summer. i went in winter so i can't see fountain and molded figure but still beautiful. it different in feeling

number 1 in SPB. There is nothing that can be said about the Hermitage that has not been written already; if you are anywhere within a 100 miles of this museum you should visit. A little known fact - every first Thursday of the month IT IS FREE for everyone regardless of whether you are Russian or not - so don't pay to enter if your stay in the city will include a first Thursday of the month. enjoy !!

feel like a queen. Getting there can be a bit of a hassle if you take the crowded marshrutkas ( minivans); interesting to take the hoovercraft from SpB. The gardens themselves need well over 2 hours to do them justice. The Palace itself is a must though any of the other museums fade after having seen it. If you are short for time just see the Palace and the upper gardens.Check the time to see when you can experience the dancing fountains.
